review.title: Nice hotel, good location, but noisy and overrated
review.reviewText:
Good: location (we walked until embarcadero), clean, renovated, nice stuff, free internet
Bad: In front of a construction, noisy, small room, cofee/tea in the room not free, not swimming pool, poor facilities
review.negativeRemarks: Price
review.locationRemarks: Macys, Chinatowns, North beach, Embarcadero (30 min walk)

review.title: Gross but great location
review.reviewText:
Day 1 the lobby smelled of fried foods.  Go up to the room on the 5th floor but it's coming in through the ducts!  I call and the operator says she's never heard of such a thing so I contact the front desk, who despite working in a lobby smelling like fried onions, doesn't know about the smell but will send an engineer.  The engineer arrives and says something's wrong with their duct system.  They're stopping cooking and the smell will go away shortly.  The smell never went away.  I had a wedding to attend the next day and there's no dry cleaning fast enough that will take the smell out, so I spray on extra perfume.  It's really really gross to sleep in a hotel room smelling of fried onions. The next day it smells like fried fish.  The day afterward, it smelled it fried somosas.  I mean these are delicious smells in a kitchen so their food is probably amazing, but really disgusting to sleep in that smell and have all your clothes smell awful.  Also, their operator and front desk pretending not to notice, when I called is, super awkward.  I had to speak with front desk in person for them to acknowledge it but they just said it'll go away... every day they said this.  Perhaps they're working in that 24/7 and can't tell the difference anymore but it's super noticeable to anyone who steps through the front door.
Also, this hotel is not sound proofed, so you can hear other people's showers running early in the morning and late at night; also you hear all deliveries.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was central.  Easy to take an uber everywhere or walk 3 blocks to hop on the train.  Starbucks in next door.  Molton Brown products.
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of the fried food smell in hotel rooms!  Staff should acknowledge the issue, rather than pretend like it exist.
review.locationRemarks: Starbucks next door.  Walgreens within 1 block.  Lots of great restaurants and bars within walking distance.

review.title: Noisy Alley
review.reviewText: We normally LOVE Campton Place. We have been staying there for years. The hotel and staff are the best of the best. We had a "city view" room reserved but, for some reason, we were on Campton Place (alley way). No view at all but we thought it would be nice and quiet as we like to crack open our window at night. Apparently, there is a night club in that alley that comes to life around midnight. We looked out our window and there was a long line of partiers. They were having a great time! Very noisy up until around 3:00am. Next time we will make sure to ask to NOT be on that side of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Area, room decor, staff, restaurant .... everything! Just not the noisy room on the alley!
review.negativeRemarks: Another room location.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, restaurants, walking ..... everything!

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: excellent hotel in Union Square San Francisco California,best of the City; turn down service,special attention, Thanks again for a wonderful stay
review.locationRemarks: perfect location in Union Square

review.title: Boutiquey Feel with Large Commercial Conveniences
review.reviewText: From early check in, to our 3 hour lunch in the hotel restaurant to the day we had to say goodbye, one member of the staff was more gracious and helpful than the next.  The location was perfect for us, i.e. next to food, drink and shopping.  Spent 4 lovely days and nights exploring all Union Square and the Embarcadero had to offer.

review.title: Enjoyed the hotel, BUT
review.reviewText: The location was great, the hotel is quite nice and comfortable.  There was a large problem with the room, however.  When we arrived about 11:30 PM, they graciously showed us to a room that DID NOT HAVE A STALL SHOWER.  I was in San Francisco to celebrate my 82nd birthday and I was very specific when I made the reservation.  I took the front desk more than an hour to find a room, but one was eventually found.  That room was a large, king bed room with a very large chaise lounge/couch at the food of the bed.   It was to be a city view room, but the window was quite small and had another love seat directly in front of it.  The room was nice, but had way too much furniture in it.  The bath was nice with a single sink, a wonderful stall shower and a toilet that was extremely difficult to use because it had been squeezed between a very large tub and the wall.  The hotel did everything they could to help; the design  of the room was the problem.LEd

review.title: Wonderful staff but common areas were very lacking
review.reviewText: It is small like a boutique hotel.  Entry way, lobby and bar are all so small and does not have the grand feel that you would want from a 4 1/2 star. Bar was probably the smallest I have ever seen. House car is wonderful to have and staff was very nice.  Room was clean and bed was wonderful but room did not feel extra luxurious.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, and the huge full length mirror in the bedroom

review.title: Great venue
review.reviewText: Terrific location with many amenities including a superb dining room + very helpful staff always. Rooms are small but beautifully appointed for a 5-star stay in comfort. Will definitely come back again and again...
review.locationRemarks: Breakfast was next door at Starbucks and located 1/2 a block from Union Square with many shops + the park.

review.title: Amazing hotel right by union square
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was amazing, but there was one man that stood out, his name is Dan.  Whoever chose him to be the first person you meet before you walk into the hotel is genius! We loved the hotel, but Dan made our stay that much better. He's one of the nicest people you will ever meet.  He is the type of person that can bring a smile to your face no matter the type of day you are having. His joy is contagious.  He definitely restores my faith in humanity. As for the hotel, it is nice and very clean. All of the hotel staff is amazing! All of the employees are so friendly and happy.   I look forward to staying at this hotel again, I will be telling my friends about it too!

The most important thing for me was location, it's close to many attractions and transportation. As most luxury properties food was expensive. Overall it was a good stay.

Gratuities were added to our hotel (bar) bill after it had been signed and without our agreement.  We were also invoiced for teabags which we never had.  These were removed after we questionned the items.

We were on the second floor of the hotel facing the street & thought it was going to be a bit noisy.  However, it was extremely quiet & our sleep was never disturbed.
I would definitely recommend this hotel.

They did not bring out the right items, or I was halfway done with my meal when they brought what I actually ordered out. Other then that, no complaints. Exceptional and I will be back!

review.reviewText: Great experience, location, amenities, and services. Will stay here again when I'm back in SF.

review.title: Top drawer hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: One day we were out of the hotel only one hour. I requested the room cleaned during this brief window, and it was----immaculately!  And with a smile.  This can-do attitude pervades the hotel.  Every thing about it is first class.
review.negativeRemarks: Cannot think of a thing that needed improvement.
review.locationRemarks: Every kind of shop you can imagine is nearby.  The transportation to all parts of the city is at the doorstep.

review.title: The only selling point is location
review.reviewText: Not obvious how or why Taj is rated 4.5 stars either as a guide or in terms of reviews. The Grand Hyatt across the street is superior in every dept.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Great stay from beginning to end!  Great location in Union Square.  Came in from SFO and were able to walk from the Bart Station to the hotel.  Staff was so delightful and the room was gorgeous!  Wish we stayed longer!  And free wifi!!!  You don't find that often these days.
Perfect setting in an elegant hotel with world class restuarant

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Staff were phenomenal. The service was out of this world.. Definitely got what we payed for!
It was a great hotel.  The staff was wonderful and very accommodating.    Everything in our room was perfect except the beds were a little uncomfortable.   I think its time to replace them.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds need to be replaced.    A little too hard and I felt I was on a slope.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and Union Square was great

review.title: Great location and Great staff!
review.reviewText: Stayed here on a friends recommendation for the location, as we were bringing my 89 year old uncle here from Texas for his birthday. Upon arrival, he found a birthday dessert waiting in his room. One night we were going to dinner close by, and my uncle was overheard to say he didn't know if he was up for walking. Suddenly we were getting into the hotel's limo, being driven to our dinner! Lovely and thoughtful personal touches is why we liked this hotel so much! And of course the location by Union Square close to everything! Will definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks:
Friendly staff, great service, location, small and quiet in the middle of everything
,
review.negativeRemarks: One Small closet in room, bathroom in suite had one sink and no counter space
review.locationRemarks: Shopping at Gumps and Uniqlo were fun! Fabulous lunch at Tadish! Fabulous dinner at Farallon!

review.title: Perfect hotel in a great walkable location
review.reviewText: Perfect botique 5 star hotel walkable to numerous eateries and shoping in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size is great with all the amenties and comfort you would expect in a 5 star property.

review.title: Best hotel in SF
review.reviewText:
Awesome hotel. Cleaning was outstanding.
The best part was the gym. The gym is always a second priority on most hotels but not on Thai compton. It was the best hotel gym I've ever seen with free weights, machines, bikes with TV monitors, ice cold water and even free headphones (!). 

5 stars for the hotel but 6 for the gym.

review.title: Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText:
The hotel is really close to Union Square(about 2 mins walk....) 
The room is quite big and the beds are comfy.

review.title: Birthday
review.reviewText: Excellent service! When the staff found out it was my birthday, they surprised me with a special dessert delivered to our room! Would definitely stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: Service, quiet, centrally located, employees/staff were great! Great amenities!
review.negativeRemarks: No recommendations here. Everything was perfect!
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located; across from Union Square; close to entertainment, shopping, art galleries, perfect place to stay!

review.title: Excellent location, service, facilities
review.reviewText:
Our check in was flawless, the doorman remembered my name, everyone was very polite and helpful, and the room was beautiful and impeccably clean. The restaurant's food was first class (one Michelin star), though I will say that the staff was perhaps a bit defensive. 

Our room was perhaps a bit small, but well laid out and equipped.

Indeed, my only complaint was that the staff was perhaps a bit *too* solicitous. It's nice to be treated like a friend of the family, but there's a line where personal service become perhaps a bit too personal. Long discussions about our plans for our holiday from the bellboy, for example, are a bit much.
review.locationRemarks: It's in the Union Square area, and therefore close to many things.

review.title: Nice hotel close to downtown.
review.reviewText: Great hotel and nice people and close to downtown.

review.title: Lovely hotel in excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff are great. The rooms are big and the bathrooms are enormous.  Everything was quiet and comfortable with one exception. The bath towels were cheap and scratchy - not soft at all. Very strange to go to such effort with all other details and to miss this one important item.
review.negativeRemarks: Bath towels were scratchy and cheap
review.locationRemarks: Great location, right on Union Sq. Check out Sears Fine Food for wonderful breakfast

review.reviewText:
Excellent hotel in the heart of the city.
Hotel staff is very friendly.  Restaurant food is awesome.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel. Floors a little funky, with half floors. Makes taking your own bags to room a pain. A lot of construction surrounding the area, but what big city doesn't?
review.locationRemarks: In the middle of downtown, so close to everything

review.title: San Francisco Taj Campton
review.reviewText:
Staff support excellent
Facilities clean but not 5 star for such s high cost. Paint is durty in places, glass tables scratched carpet worn in halls, etc
Dinning ver expensive but excellent

review.title: Fantastic boutique hotel!
review.reviewText:
Rooms a bit small but overall very nice hotel!
Great little bar below with fantastic food and cocktails..

review.title: A excellent hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with excellent staff & the best location

review.title: Great Location right in the heart of downtown
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel, great service, awesome room, near everything.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable room, needed nothing.  Like being at home.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: All the major stores are but a block away.  Walking distance to many stores, great restaurants and events.

review.title: Good location. Great stuff. Rooms needs work.
review.reviewText: Room 1504 is next to the elevator and the noise level are hard to except. The bathroom is small and feels cramped. The room was small and very old school. Hotel rooms around the world had evolved. The Taj in SFO hasnt.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location....close to everything.  Walked to Ferry Bldg. and then down to Fisherman's Wharf.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi should be free.

managementResponses.response:
I am so sorry you were disappointed in your stay with us, but do thank you for letting us know of your concerns. Our goal is to provide the best possible experience for each of our guests and I am so sorry we did not live up to your expectations.
Your room should certainly not have smelled of smoke in our non-smoking hotel. At times some guests will smoke regardless of the very hefty add on to their bills and deep cleaning must be done to remove to the smoke smell. I regret it was not as effective as it should have been. I also regret that you were disturbed by the food smell in the hall. After investigating, I found the door from the kitchen had been left ajar, allowing the odors to go up the stairwell. The Chef has counseled his team on the importance of ensuring that door is kept closed. Your mattress was replaced only two years ago and should not have been sagging. I have asked our engineering department to check both the mattress and the AC.
I hope you will give us another opportunity to restore your confidence in Taj Campton Place and allow us to welcome you back the next time you are in San Francisco.

review.title: Old style hotel past its prime
review.reviewText:
I stayed in this property 20 years ago and remember it as the old grand dame of SF hotels, with understated elegance.  Well, all good things come to an end, I suppose.   

Although part of this elegance remains, the room (number 619) was very disappointing for the following reasons: 1) it smelled like smoke even though it was non-smoking room;  2) there was a pervasive food smell coming out of the emergency exit right outside our door, so every time we walked out of the room, it felt we were passing the kitchen;  3) there is either no insulation on the windows, or it's not sufficient, since the room warmed up with direct sunlight and the AC was too weak to cool it off ; and, finally and worst of all, 4) the mattress was u-shaped and it got increasingly worse in our 5-day stay.   

So, our recommendation is to stay at newer, better maintained hotels, of which there are plenty in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Isolate kitchen food smell.   Change the mattresses in rooms that need it.   Be firmer with non-smoking policy.   Improve window insulation or AC.

review.title: A Nice Hotel to Stay at While in SF
review.reviewText: Our first choice of hotels whenever we stay in SF is the Taj Campton Place.  We like the location of the hotel near Union Square and especially the hotel staff whom we have come to know quite well and treat like family. The location allows us to navigate around the city but using the different modes of transportation available to us.  Despite the construction around Union Square,  the Campton Place for us, is still an ideal hotel to call home when in SF.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and hotel staff can't be beat.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square and close to many stores and restaurants.  Accessible to taxis, muni, bart, etc

review.title: I only stay at the Taj when I go to SF!
review.reviewText: This is the second time I've stayed at the Taj Campton Place in SF and I still love it. This time we came with our two puppies, for Labor Day weekend. I love that the hotel is pet friendly, and they really took care of us and our dogs.  When we arrived they brought up a tray for the pups with two bowls, a bottle of water, some potty bags, and treats!  Talk about awesome service!  The reason I keep coming back is for this very reason, the service can't be beat.  Besides that though, the rooms are comfy, clean, and roomy (we stayed in the deluxe room).  I also love the fact that the staff take the time to remember your name which is a small thing but makes you feel you're coming home.  During our stay, one of our dogs got sick and threw up on the room floor which was cleaned up promptly.  But upon checkout they did charge us extra for a deep cleaning that they had to do ($300).  That was a little steep but I didn't mind, and I agreed to pay.  A couple days later though I saw on my bank statement that they had refunded me the fee in full!  When I called them I was told that they didn't charge me for it, and that it was free of charge, a "Labor Day surprise".  Awesome!!!  I will definitely go back again, and recommend it to anyone going to the Bay Area.

review.title: Great Hotel, perfrect location
review.reviewText: From the time we checked in to the time we left the service was wonderful, the room was extremely clean and the location was very central. Great tips from the staff on places to eat.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and cleanliness of the rooms

review.title: Great Location, friendly, excellent food
review.reviewText:
Location is perfect, just off Union Square. Love that it is small. Staff knew us. Staff was excellent, front desk extremely helpful, concierges gave us excellent recommendations for local restaurants, and had wonderful assistance when my suitcase handle broke. (Fixed! And the fellow was bashful/embarrassed when I tipped him).

Bar is small, private, excellent. Bar menu is superb. The restaurant, Indian-Californian Fusion, is amazing for dinner, as one would expect of a Michelin-rated restaurant. Price is also what you would expect from the rating, but to us it was worth it.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were small but good. Really liked the reading lights above the bed, sliding doors to bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking ($63!) and high daily price for wifi ($12.95 per device!). Get free wifi next door at Starbucks, or Caffe Bellini in Union Square.

review.title: loved our stay
review.reviewText: As my traveling companion said, "This is the best hotel ever."
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing missing was a coffee pot.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect.-- close to the conference we were attending, close to public transportation, and close to good eating places.

review.title: Decent stay but nothing special
review.reviewText:
Rooms are decent value for money and very comfi beds.
Some rooms are to be avoided (e.g. 211) as located next to their private dining suite and facing the street.
Front desk staff is terrific, concierge a bit hit and miss.
If you are there for the city and not the hotel experience can recommend staying there. Def decent stay...

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: Staff was beyond accommodating, location is great. Highly recommend
The staff was amazing and the accomedations exceeded our expectations!  Great location to union square.

review.title: Great Hotel, great location in Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Everything was great about this hotel.
I would definitely go back to this hotel.

review.title: Mixed Bag
review.reviewText: Location good next to Sbx and shopping.  Facilities average - few electrical outlets, small desk in room.  Towels thirsty.  Wifi extra cost not disclosed upfront.  Staff friendly helpful knowledgable about area.  Inroom service best when ordering indian cuisine.  Gym facilities such as they are open 24h bit old unsupervised and several machines not working properly.  Overall mixed bag.

review.title: Great Discovery!
review.reviewText: I did my homework when selecting a hotel to stay at with my family for a several day vacation. The Taj Campton had high reviews and with Expedia having a deal package of flight plus hotel...it was a great deal. My husband and I enjoyed breakfast at the hotel. The room service meals were great too. The location of this hotel to Union Square and tourist buses was handy. This hotel has a super friendly and helpful staff. This is a very nice hotel. Despite being in the city, the room was quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked everything about the Taj Campton...service was great as was the cleanliness, location, overall quality very classy.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have been nice to have little refrigerator in room, bit really didn't miss it that much.
review.locationRemarks: Starbucks was close by. Union Square where tourist pickup for buses are a couple blocks away. The best tourist deal are the hop on, hop off buses. The

review.title: A great hotel
review.reviewText: We arrived early and they took our cell number to call when the room was ready. We walked the 1 1/2 blocks to China town for a shopping spree and when we returned our room was ready. We had a great room, where the staff was friendly and the hotel was super clean. The restraunt has fantastic food and the deserts are to die for. I give this hotel the highest rating.
review.negativeRemarks: I only wish we could have stayed longer.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is close to every thing, including transportation.

review.title: Highly recommended!
review.reviewText:
An absolute pleasure from start to finish! Taj Campton Place is in a perfect location, close to all attractions and has top class friendly and helpful staff.
Fantastic value for money with all the touches of luxury and comforts of home - I'll definitely be returning for my next stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: We just returned from a four night stay at Taj ton Place. The hotel is situated one block from Union Square and is a very convenient locatoon without the hustle bustle of the Unoon Square area. Well appointed rooms, immaculately maintained.  Rooms can be a little on the small side. I recommend delux rooms for a larger space. Wonderful deep soaking tubs and toiletries of high quality. Loved the Nepresso machines. Very pleasant staff. We appreciate good boutique hotels as they seem more personal and more quiet than large chains. Concierge had great recommendations for dining. It was a very pleassnt stay.

review.title: Brilliant location
review.reviewText: Facilities are perfect and the staff could not be nicer. Excellent chef. Rooms are very comfortable and despite being so well situated bit is very quiet. Overall a good experience but small financial things annoyed. One pays for wifi in the room. In order to have a cot for my granddaughter I was forced to change to a more expensive room. These are irritating things
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were a delight. The decor is pleasing and rooms very comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: I was annoyed at having to pay for wifi in the room when every adjacent coffee shop and store has free. It is annoying
review.locationRemarks: Location superb. China town is on the doorstep as well as UnionnSquare

review.title: Boutique Hotel just off Union Square-No Free Wifi
review.reviewText: While we love this quiet hotel in a great location, you would think that free wi-fi would be ubitquitous in the tech hub of San Francisco.  Not only was it $25 per day, it was $25 per day, per device.    While the staffperson at checkout was friendly and sympathetic, he was not empowered to credit our bill for even one device.  We will not be staying at the hotel again for this reason only.

review.title: Certainly not the 5-start hotel you've been told.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is smaller, older, and not what I expected from a hotel with such a high rating. The room was extremely limited in space, only had a smaller-sized shower (no tub), smaller sized bathroom, and absolutely no views.

When we got off the elevator, my wife and I found it hard to believe that we still had to walk up about 12 or so stairs to get to our floor. Not usually a big problem because we're both in good shape, but with luggage, it was a huge inconvenience. 

The room was clean, but extremely tight quartered. The coffee was the only thing in the room that was free, but you could only have one cup per person, per day without paying extra. I didn't feel too very welcomed there, although the staff was pleasant.

I most assuredly would not book a room in the Taj Campton again, unless it was a last resort for me to choose from.

An overall rating of 3.5 is more than adequate for this location, even though the price says it should be at least a 4.5.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is quite nice. Centrally located in downtown. The staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The size of the rooms, but this would require a total make-over. The mini stairway to actually get to your room was odd and inconvenient.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location with the City at your disposal.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great hotel, Everything was excellent. Room was kind of small but considering we are in San fran all was as expected. Door men could pay a little more attention to opening the doors for guests  instead of day dreaming and staring into mid air. Other than that experience was perfect.

review.title: What you hope your room will be
review.reviewText: Elegant, luxurious, and absolutely beautiful from the front door to the toiletries.  What I wish every room could be.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing we found
review.locationRemarks: It is blocks from China Town and good hike to the Fisherman's Wharf and lots of great bakeries and shops nearby.

review.title: Great hotel!

The Taj Campton Place is fabulous. It is beautiful, well-appointed, and well-located. The lobby is beautiful, as is the bar and Michelin-starred restaurant. The rooms were much larger than expected, with wonderful linens and nicely-decorated baths. There was plenty of room for us to conveniently place our many personal items, as well as a nice closet and numerous drawers. The Molton-Brown toiletries were a great touch.
The staff were all friendly, professional and knowledgeable. They helped us navigate all over the city efficiently and arranging transportation for us.
This is a wonderful place to stay!!!

review.title: quiet refuge in The City
review.reviewText:
everything goes smoothly
this is really enough but expedia wants me to write more so i will, but it is the lastt review I am taking time to do.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: I selected this hotel blindly as my trip was sort of last minute but I couldn't be happier with my selection. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was very accommodating. Great location as well. Best getaway in a long time. Thank u Taj Campton.

managementResponses.response:
Dear David,

Thank you for spending the time to write a review and express your concerns regarding our hotel. Please know that we take all of our reviews seriously, and thank you for bringing this to our attention.

We wish you would have phoned the lobby if your neighboring room had been too loud, for we would have been able to ensure you a better stay by possibly moving you, or speaking with your neighbors. We are always delighted to see past guests, for we consider them to be a part of the Taj family when they return. We apologize that you felt that way and that we did not extend that same feeling towards you. That is not the way we want our guests to feel.

We sincerely apologize that you felt embarrassed by what was said in regards to your breakfast check being fulfilled. We will follow up with our F&B department so that that doesn't happen again.

We hope that you allow us the opportunity to host you once more so that we can leave you with a more positive impression.

Warm Regards,
Ashrafi Matcheswala
General Manager

review.title: Good location but check your bill.
review.reviewText:
We booked this hotel due to the high Expedia rating. I have to say that I was disappointed with a number of things at the hotel. Firstly our room was very small and you could hear the occupants of the neighbouring room well into the night. For me the staff have their favourite guests that obviously stay at the hotel on a regular basis. They were so busy falling over certain guests on the Saturday morning at breakfast that we could not find anyone to sign off the breakfast bill. When we returned to breakfast on Sunday I had a very embarrassing moment where a member of staff said that we had left without paying in front of all the other guests at breakfast. I also had another embarrassing moment when we came to check out of the hotel as well. My deal included breakfast for my wife and I yet when it came to check out this was not taken off the bill. Despite phoning down the night before to ensure all would be well with this. 15 minutes of arguing on the way out and finally the receptionist agreed with what i was saying.
The only positive was that given that we were on our honeymoon the hotel kindly gave us a bottle of champagne to celebrate.
I would not recommend this hotel to business colleagues who travel to San Francisco regularly, and I would not use the hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Communication of staff
review.locationRemarks: Great location and easy access to all the sites of San Francisco

review.title: Perfect location for a long weekend
review.reviewText:
We visited S.F. for a long weekend of walking, dining and reconnecting with old friends.
The Taj Campton was at the heart of our wonderful visit and location. Our primary reason for
the visit was my husband's birthday. Since S.F. is one of our favorite cities, it was a good reason to celebrate there. The Campton graciously acknowledged his birthday, and treated us, as I'm certain they did all other guests, with great hospitality and kindness. We were always acknowledged by hotel staff with a smile and service. The room was impeccably clean, and kept that way from morning to night. Any help we needed with city suggestions, restaurants, transportation, etc., they supplied.
The room, best of all, was so deliciously quiet…we were able to get the rest and vacation that we so needed.
And, at the very end of our long weekend, when my husband left his sports jacket and glasses on the lobby couch as we were off to the airport, the hotel driver, Alan, made a phone call and my husbands belongings were sent off to us that day.
Service, needless to say, was gracious and exceptional.
We will return.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for spending the time to review our hotel. We are thrilled to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us, and that we made you feel welcomed. Additionally, we are delighted to hear that you found our team to be exceptionally helpful.

We look forward to the opportunity to host you on your next trip to San Francisco.

Warm Regards,
Ashrafi Matcheswala
General Manager

review.title: Cleanest Hotel in US, Great Staff
review.reviewText:
I travel 2 weeks out of every month, been in a LOT of hotels. Taj Campton Place was the cleanest hotel room in the US. I'm not kidding, it was comfortable, clean, quiet. Maid service turned down room each night, cleaned room twice daily. Bell staff summoned cabs quickly and I never opened a door myself the entire week stay. Front desk staff gave excellent recommendations and perfect directions. In SF for 1 week conference, and really wasn't expecting much. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and again and recommend to others.

This hotel is a GEM - I hope it stays like this forever.
review.positiveRemarks: So quiet. Pleasant staff. Impeccable cleaning crew - they really made this stay awesome.
review.negativeRemarks: Finding an available cab was a nightmare throughout SF. However when leaving the hotel I never had to wait once.
review.locationRemarks: China Town within walking distance, shopping nearby.

managementResponses.response:

review.reviewText: Well appointed and run, boutique hotel in excellent location.
review.negativeRemarks: The provision of wireless internet in rooms and lobby.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay here. Perfect location, beds very comfortable, room clean and staff exceptionally friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Lost iPad
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel in a great location but I left my iPad in my room when I checked out and it was never seen again. I know I left it on the desk in my room and it makes me very upset that a great weekend in a great hotel is ruined because they couldn't locate what I left behind.

review.title: Great location and service
review.reviewText: Location can't be beat; staff was very attentive; restaurant is outstanding. However, the teenager who used the business center computer was annoying. Kudos to his parents.

review.title: Wonderful hotel close to Union Square!
review.reviewText: We absolutely loved this hotel! The staff and service were exceptional!!! The rooms were beautiful and clean. We would definitely recommend this hotel to all our family and friends!!!

review.title: Not really a 4 star in my view
review.reviewText: Didn't seem like a 4 star to me - probably 3.5. A bit tired. This isn't the first time this has happened to me with Expedia Unpublished. I love Expedia except for this. It's often the older properties that offer the unpublished deals - that at some point had been rated high but have slipped. Not all the star ratings are accurate on the regular Expedia site either but at least you can search the hotel and view photos and do your own homework

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Extremely impressed with the level of customer services. All around a good hotel
review.negativeRemarks: The room is a bit small and perhaps the parking fee little expensive in comparison to other hotels. 63.00 a day
review.locationRemarks: Union square.

review.title: Great Hotel right off Union Square
review.reviewText: The Taj Campton is a beautiful hotel that has it all. Great staff, beautiful rooms, fabulous service, a great bar and a great restaurant.

review.title: Decent hotel but was a bit of a disappointment.
review.reviewText:
I had heard good things about this hotel for many years but had never stayed there. I can say that the hotel is well located, nicely appointed, has a comfortable bed and friendly staff. I had a problem with the place and wouldn't stay there because of the following:
- The plumbing was noisy and vibrated from time to time.
- At this room price range, I wasn't expecting to be charged for the internet connection. I thought that was a bit petty. And, the internet was not terribly fast and would get hung up for several seconds up to a minute or so from time to time. Lastly on this topic, only one device is allowed to be connected per room. So, if your computer is connected, then your partner/wife/significant other's device cannot be connected, and there is no free internet in the lobby.
- The room was a bit too small for my taste.
- There was a night club that ran until the early hours of the morning whose front door was just below my window, and there was no warning from the staff about this, so it was very difficult to get to sleep because of that.
- When my neighbor left his unit, his door closing would cause all the walls of my unit to vibrate as if he had slammed his door.
- The staff allowed me a 13:00 checkout on my last day there, but still the cleaning staff was knocking on my door at 10:00 to clean my room, so they were clearly not notified by the front desk staff.....
review.positiveRemarks: The location is its best attribute.
review.negativeRemarks: See above.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Powell Street Bart and cable cars. Within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf. Plenty of nice restaurants in the area.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Expedia Traveler,

Thank you for taking the time to rate our hotel. We are sorry that you were dissatisfied with the first room that you were given, but we are happy to hear that you enjoyed your second room after your upgrade.

We hope we have the opportunity to host you once more.

Warm Regards,
Ashrafi Matcheswala
General Manager

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: original room was to small, had to upgrade for more money

review.title: An Ideal Place to Stay for Us
review.reviewText: We having been staying at theTaj Campton Place whenever we are in San Francisco. We have enjoyed and continue to enjoy the hotel's friendly staff who always seem to treat us like family when there. We found it an ideal location to navigate within the city and when venturing out of the city.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is near Union Square with access to Chinatown, the US stores and gallerias, muni bus stops/metro stations and restaurants.

review.title: great location, great customer service
review.reviewText: In San Fran for a conference. I've stayed in the city previously and Taj Campton will be top of list for return visits. All staff - from front desk to cleaning people to doormen - are incredibly helpful/friendly and really set this hotel apart. Accomodations were good and extremely comfortable bed. Location near Union Square is great and allowed me to walk everywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: Great value, customer service, and bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Ideally wi-fi should be free. At minimum, it should be by room, not device.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located. Quick trolley to fisherman's wharf. Everything else downtown is walking distance.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Expedia Traveler,

Thank you for staying with us for a second time, and sharing your review with us. We are glad that you enjoyed your second stay, but hopefully your third stay with us will be even better.

Looking forward to welcoming you again.

Warm Regards,
Ashrafi Matcheswala
General Manager

review.title: Crear location, wounderful Restaurant and pleasent
review.reviewText: Second time staying. Great experiencia, Will stAy again

review.title: Very pleasant experience
review.reviewText: This is the 4th Taj hotel I've stayed in since 2008. I find them all comfortable , with a very pleasant staff . The amenities are top notch , love the Moulton Brown toiletries , the best! Quiet , comfort, with the best location . I will recommend this hotel and hope to go back again.

review.title: Very nice hotel hiding in the Hyatt's shadow
review.reviewText: The staff were super-friendly, the room nicely appointed and the bed very comfortable. It was a little weird that the shower only had glass covering about 1/3 of it, leading to water easily splashing out on to the bathroom floor. And I'm not quite sure why they leave all of the lights and TV on every day after the room is serviced. But other than that, a good stay.
review.negativeRemarks: There is no need to waste electricity leaving the lights and TV on all day.
review.locationRemarks: A block off Union Square, tons of restaurants nearby, easy access to public transit

review.title: Great experience in heart of SF
review.reviewText: Had a very good experience and I appreciated that it was only short walking distance to the Moscone Conference Center (about 10min walk). With a Starbucks around the corner each day was started in the best possible way. I heard people recommending the hotel restaurant but I never got to try it.

review.title: Superb location; great staff.
review.reviewText: The hotel's location is unbeatable. Union Square is a block away and Chinatown is an easy walk. The staff was without exception friendly and efficient, an uncommon combination. An atrium-like opening brings natural light into the inner hallways. The room was small but comfortable and the bathroom was quite nice. Breakfast was a little pricey ($46 including tax and tip for a continental breakfast for two) but that may be the going rate in well-to-do San Francisco. Two minor quibbles: One of the building's mechanical systems makes a periodic rumbling noise that took some getting used to. And why charge for wi-fi here in the digital capital of the world? But all in all a most comfortable stay.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The location was excellent (close to Union Square)-close to dining & shopping options.. We had dinner at a local French cafe .. Cafe Claude...and took the little one to the Exploratorium. No problems with public transport to and from the hotel. Only minor drawback was the gym which was a little dated . Otherwise the service and facilities were excellent. Would definitely return.
review.negativeRemarks: Gym and lifts.
review.locationRemarks: Great location if u are a foodie..walk to Mission for Mexican and sample the cafes in the financial district.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: great staff and service, only one elevator during the whole week, the other was broken.

review.title: Perfect Location and Service
review.reviewText: This hotel defines what service at a 5 star hotel should be. Though this isn't rated a 5 star-it very well can be. Great rooms. location, service was amazing. Good coffee in the morning! (Important for business traveler)
review.negativeRemarks: Parking rates at $62 are very steep!
review.locationRemarks: Its San Fran- Everything!

review.title: Good location and reasonable rates
review.reviewText: Room very small and lighting poor; generally uncomfortable

review.title: business travel
review.reviewText:
excellent travel experience and a perfect location. the staff is excellent.
regards
review.negativeRemarks: a little bigger room
review.locationRemarks: union square

review.title: The heaven in the center of SF
review.reviewText: Hey Guys! I loved this hotel) Services are pretty well. You will definitely enjoy your stay there!
Comfortable bed and quiet room.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location for public transit to visit museums and sights.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi should be free. Also, each guest should be allowed more than one Nespresso or tea in the room each day without a $2.00 charge per each.
review.locationRemarks: Union square is great for shopping and transit to other areas in the city.

review.title: Great staff and location! Will return--Again.
Close to Union Sq and Moscone center
review.reviewText: Only reason I gave this hotel a less than excellent rating was the absolutely terrible quality of the room lighting. Impossible to read ordinary print in the evening. Luckily we had e-readers.

review.title: boutique hotel in union square
review.positiveRemarks: Smaller, boutique hotel in Union Square, surrounded by shopping and dining options. Convenient to the Moscone Center for meeting we were attending.
review.negativeRemarks: Would love for there to be more space in the room to store clothes. We were there for 5 nights and didn't have enough room to unpack.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Our room was hot and the thermostat did not appear to be working correctly. I didn't sleep well.
review.negativeRemarks: The cooling system.

review.title: Tasteful oasis near Union Square
review.reviewText: the hotel was absolutely wonderful. The décor was elegant, the staff incredibly helpful and professional, but not intrusive. had a very nice peak a view of Union Square and the fountain below from window seat.

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: We had such an amazing experience at the hotel. The doorman and staff went out of their way to make us feel right at home. The room was nice, the bathroom was dreamy!!! Overall a wonderful experience, will definitely return.

review.title: Very Central, KEY to travellers !
review.reviewText:
Great Service, super polite !! , Classy place no doubt !
Always feeling welcomed whether on our way in or out the door !
review.positiveRemarks: As I said before, the central location is a key to us when travelling, right in the heart of the city, just blocks from BART Powell station
review.negativeRemarks: $12.50 for Wi-Fi per day?? These days when any Starbucks/restaurants/buses/malls has it free !! for a Hotel of that category is simply ridiculous !

review.title: Value
review.reviewText: Location is great but not even close to worth the price

review.title: Outstanding Experience
review.reviewText: Great for business and leisure. The Hotel is centrally located close to Union Square in downtown San Francisco. Staff are most helpful and knowledgeable. Décor and flowers are beautiful. Restaurant and café are well appointed with excellent choices. This is a winner in all regards. My only (very minor) comment would be smallish rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything! this is a splendid hotel. Service, décor, knowledge by staff all @100%
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing. everything was excellent
review.locationRemarks: Very centrally located close to Union Square. Shopping and activities are right there!

review.title: Great location and feeling of luxury!
review.reviewText: Great location right off Union Square - near shops, Chinatown and public transportation. Concierge and front desk extremely knowledgeable. Hotel very clean and has a feeling of comfortable intimacy b/c not a huge high-rise chain. Attention to detail makes this a luxurious place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Wonderful staff - very helpful and responsive. Nice little bar/grill for drinks and snacks or light dinner. Highly recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Only suggestion - need to put out more pastry choices and quantity for complementary breakfast and keep the coffee, milk and creamer coming.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to many sights, including North Beach and even Fisherman's Wharf. Lots of shops and Chinatown right around the corner.

review.title: Nice hotel but noisy room
review.reviewText: Beautiful facility, but thin walls separating the rooms and slept very little as a result. Front desk and valet staff were excellent. Restaurant brunch was expensive and of poor quality.
review.positiveRemarks: Very decorative room with nice amenities. Front desk and valet staff.
review.negativeRemarks: When a quiet room is requested, staff should ensure quietude. I paid a lot of money for this hotel room and expected a good night's sleep.

review.title: Fantastic Location
review.reviewText: Fantastic location. Close to shopping etc. Rooms were average. Staff was excellent and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Taj has changed very little at The Compton Place... it is still a great hotel at Union Square. Staff is wonderful.

review.title: Superb and ideally situated.
review.reviewText: A superb "classic" hotel with friendly efficient staff. The room turndown service was a pleasant surprise each evening. The location is ideal for everything going on, especially for getting the hop on hop off bus from union square. The Taj experience certainly added to the experience for my daughter and I as we left our hearts there.

review.title: best kept secret !!
review.reviewText: room rate a little pricey however you get what you pay for . a beautiful comfortable facility ran extremely professional, extremely accomodating staff. would definitely staff again ..
review.negativeRemarks: didnt have any
review.locationRemarks: adjacent to union square superb shopping

review.title: Kim
review.reviewText:
amazing central location to downtown San Fran. All the shopping, restaurants, tours are all w/in walking distance.
Beautiful hotel, nice complimentary continental breakfast each morning.
Room was well laid out, comfy bed and a beautiful bathroom.
Staff was very friendly and helpful.
The only drawback was parking was crazy expensive at the hotel. Other than that, wonderful experience.
review.negativeRemarks: price of parking
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Ideal for a special trip to San.Francisco
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel right on Union Square. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the rooms were spotless and spacious.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the decor and the fresh flowers
review.locationRemarks: Great location right on Union Square

review.title: A weekend getaway
review.reviewText:
The basic room was quite compact.

The bathroom was spacious, but the towels were cheap and rough.

The staff was very accommodating and helpful.

By the time I arrived at the continental breakfast, all that was left was one muffin.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location and the comfortable bed. I also enjoyed the Molton Brown personal care products.
review.negativeRemarks: The towels were cheap and not soft. There was no pen to write with, only a pencil.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Union Square.

review.title: A little bit disappointing
review.reviewText: Only one cup of coffee or tea per person a day is not that very pleasing!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is great and staff were amazing.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-fi was extra - $12 per device. Why not just charge a few dollars more for the room? Alternatively, there's a Starbucks next door with free wifi.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic - as close to Union Square as you can get without actually being on it.

review.title: Luxurious Union Square Stay
review.reviewText: Staff was very professional and welcoming. Room was VERY comfortable, mattress quality extremely comfortable. Felt luxurious.
review.negativeRemarks: Could hear the elevator
review.locationRemarks: My favorite location for San Francisco tourism.

review.title: Small hotel with a family feel.
review.reviewText: Received excellent service from Eduardo at the concierge desk.

review.title: Great location, great service, highly recommended
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location. Rooms are small but not a big issue for me since I was a single traveler and did not spend much time there. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful when needed. They even let me store my bag there after checkout while I attended my conference and before my flight.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel near union square
review.reviewText: Close to all shops, Chinatown & union square. Great place. Would stay there again!

review.title: Beautiful hotel, very close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The Taj is a beautiful hotel, close to Union Square and all the shopping San Francisco has to offer. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms are very comfortable and large by SF standards, and the food in the restaurant is wonderful.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the value and the staff.

review.title: Elegance and Comfort
review.reviewText: What a lovely hotel with attentive and friendly staff! We felt welcomed and appreciated. The hotel restaurant is pristine, the food fresh and delicious, and the atmosphere is understated elegance. I wholeheartedly recommend the Taj Campton! We will gladly return.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the personal attention and the understated elegance of the Campton. It's close to Union Square, theaters, China Town, and North Beach.
review.negativeRemarks:
The room's thermostat

We had a little difficulty getting the thermostat in the room to keep us as cool as we wanted at night.
review.locationRemarks: The Taj Campton is in a perfect location for the activities around Union Square, just a block away.excitement

review.title: Fantastic experience, again.
review.reviewText: Second time staying with Taj Campton Place. Close to everything. Friendly and highly efficient staff. Perfect for couples of any age. Less so for families.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Union Square and excellent concierge service.
review.negativeRemarks: No pool, limited fitness facility.
review.locationRemarks: Couldn't get any better.

review.title: Great place to stay for a week!
review.reviewText: The staff could not have been kinder to my family.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Hotel Staff was very accommodating and friendly. California King room is small, however the amenities are very pleasant. The restaurant and bar were very nice; however they were also very pricy. Cannot beat the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel views were not good. Our room looked out at the wall of another building.
review.locationRemarks: 3 blocks from Chinatown, 2 blocks from the Theatre district, 2 blocks from major shopping and restaurants and 5 blocks from the F train to the wharf

review.title: Great hotel for a haven in Union Square, SF
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful, peaceful stay at the Campton, a haven in Union Square. I had not stayed at this hotel for many years,and I was impressed to see that it had not only maintained its level of service, it had upped the level. Everything about the property is slated to please the client who stays there, and welcome the traveler to a full-service, discreet hotel. I would recommend it to anyone who cares about quality and quiet, and understated elegance.

review.title: Double room
review.reviewText: Hotel is very nice and clean. Service is excellent. Bar and restaurant are first class. Our room was nice but not outstanding. Asked for 2 double beds and they only have a few of those rooms. We were in the back of the floor. A bit dark. But everything was very clean and the bathroom was huge. Overall very nice stay.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
The location is very good. Union Square is central and within walking distance to several areas you will want to see such as Chinatown, North Beach (Little Italy), the Ferry Building, and the cable car lines.
The staff were very friendly and helpful. We requested to be moved to a higher room and they accommodated us no problem. The room was cleaned up and turned down regularly and they did a very good job. My pants were accidentally grabbed up in the linens one day, and they were quick to search for them and return them to me when I brought it to their attention. The concierge was also very helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

review.title: Great Couples Getaway
review.reviewText: Incredible staff from top to bottom. Very courteous and secure. The Door Man has an incredible ability to read minds, very helpful for out-of-towners.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to everything.

review.title: Great for Business Travellers
review.reviewText: Highly convenient location in downtown SF. Walking distance to BART station (Powell St) - which means you're 20 minutes to SFO. And their high-speed internet is truly high-speed.

review.title: Find another good location hotel, not this one.
review.reviewText:
Over rated hotel, very small rooms, bad views of the rooms, bad acoustics (you can hear the next room activity).
$63 usd (for a small car and $69 for a large car) rate for one parking night in the hotel.
The reception personnel is polite but unhelpful, their policy is NOT to have the client happy until the situation gets very ugly.
If you are looking for good location try another hotel, there are many!

review.title: Best price-quality-location at San Francisco
review.reviewText: In the price-quality-location is the best option you can find in San Francisco, right on the corner of Union Square, the price is lower than many hotels that claim to be the best but the quality here was much higher than when I stayed at these luxury hotels, if visiting San Francisco definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: The best location, just in Unión Square, near of everythin (shopping, mall´s, streets, bus stops, sightseeing, everything!

review.title: An Elegant Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, centrally located, quiet room, room was a bit small, high standard of service

review.title: A quiet, classy hotel with a great staff
review.reviewText: A lovely, small hotel. Wonderful staff. Quiet and respectful. No slamming doors, no housekeepers jabbering in the hallways.
review.positiveRemarks: A modern hotel with old fashioned service
review.negativeRemarks: The parking fee was outrageous
review.locationRemarks: Perfect, just off Union Square

review.title: Super place for business travelers and couples
review.reviewText: We have stayed here before. Love this hotel--it's a nice, quiet boutique hotel, conveniently located in the heart of Union Square! Great experience, again!!
review.positiveRemarks: Molton Brown bathroom amenities, morning newspaper delivered to room, clean room, nice bed linens
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located in the heart of Union Square

review.title: Pretty hotel with great staff and many extras.
review.reviewText: A friend gave us a head's up about the Taj's small, quiet bar-something we always appreciate. Staff here and in entire hotel were friendly and professional.

review.title: Good hotel and location
review.reviewText: I never give 5 stars simply because I have to be blown away by the experience. With that said, the Taj Campton Place was a lovely hotel, in a good location, and had all the amenities needed. The bathroom was large (for SF) and the room was cozy. The only cons I experienced with my room were: A/C was mediocre (had to leave the window open to sufficiently cool down), the shower door didn't close all the way, and the toilet had a couple moments of maintenance (chain came off so the toilet didn't flush). Aside from these items, I would stay again.

review.title: Absolute best in San Fran
review.reviewText: This is truly a lovely place. Staff are amazing. The location cannot get any better. Its right across hyatt in the middle of all the shops transportation food you name it. I wish there was a taj campton everywhere. The only down side is the in hotel restaurant prices. A cream cheese bagel cost 30 bucks. Did not know the price so ordered it and was shocked. As long as you eat outside no problems. An they should really offer free wireless. Other than these small details, everything is just perfect.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: Great stay but our bed was very uncomfortable, I told the front desk and nothing was done.

review.title: 'Not so nice' Campton Place
review.reviewText: The front desk provided us the WORST possible room they had it seemed(small and ugly) as we had booked thru Expedia, while my friend who was travelling with me and who booked thru the Hotel direct at the same price, got a fabulous upgrade right in front of my eyes( and he was alone and didn't need the extra space!) His room was SO MUCH NICER!!! The the asst. manager (who checked us in) was SO RUDE and could not have been more unprofessional and ungracious! The staff is not friendly nor has doies the hotel have ANY of the old qualities that the original Campton Place had before becoming part of the TAJ chain.It was such a terrible experience I will NEVER book a TAJ hotel again! NO THANKS!!
review.negativeRemarks: staff and service
review.locationRemarks: great and convenient

review.title: Super well situated!
review.reviewText: This hotel was beautiful and my room was great. I was in town for about 38 hours, to run the Nike Women's Marathon. There is a Starbucks 65 feet from the front door, and a Jamba Juice 3 blocks away. TIffany's, Saks & Macys, as well as NIkeTown, are incredibly close and there's a Daily Grill very nearby. All in all, this hotel was awesome and I wished I could have stayed longer to take advantage of it. I didn't have a chance to try the in-room or hotel dining options, or any of the hotel features.
review.negativeRemarks: my least favourite thing would have to be the noise level - i clearly heard people in the hall and doors closing (til earplugs went in at bedtime!)

review.title: A Home Away From Home
review.reviewText: The Taj Campton Place is an ideal hotel and location to stay at around Union Square. Many of the shops and modes of transportation, such as taxis, munis, cable cars, etc. are just within walking distance or reach. Getting around the city is easy using the various modes of transportation. This was a second stay at the Taj Camptom Place this year. We look forward to staying there again in the future. While we are annual visitors to the city by the bay and have actually stayed at other comparable hotels around Union Square, we can honestly say that the Taj Campton Place makes my wife and I feel like it's a "home away from home" for us while in San Fancisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff from the front desk, doormen and even housekeeping, were friendly and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: Attentiveness when it comes to their servicing a bit faster their hotel rooms for their guests.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location. Close to shops and modes of transportation.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Overall it was a great hotel. They remembered our names and the lobby was always helpful when we needed directions. We just had a small plumbing problem with the toilet, but everything else was great.

review.title: Awesome stay
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to cali and the Taj made it a great one. The staff is great, the room is a little small but very comfortable and CLEANNN. Would go back in a heart beat.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, Great location and great service. Incredibly helpful when it counts- when one of us was sick.
review.negativeRemarks: Car parking price
review.locationRemarks: Great if you want to be close to Union Square. Great if it's your first time in San Fancisco

review.title: Business trip
review.reviewText: So impressed. Their attention to detail was amazing. I will look forward to staying there again. Thank you Taj...job well done and no corners cut.
review.positiveRemarks: Attention to detail and great location
review.negativeRemarks: Tough to get in and out of shower.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Block from Union Square

review.title: Extremely nice, welcoming and helpful staff
review.reviewText: The hotel is strategically located to the main attractions of SF. The staff are extremely nice, welcoming and helpful. Excellent first stop for our honeymoon! :)

review.title: wonderful experience
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience. The restaurant was fabulous and the most scrumptious booth bench seats in the world! The walls of the rooms are rather sparsely decorated, mainly plain beige walls, but all else was great. Highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: lack of room decor
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Right next to union square, china town, and shopping.

review.title: Nice central hotel - I'd stay here again.
review.reviewText: No complaints. I didn't really take advantage of the hotels amenities. Check in was easy and every staff member I encountered offered to help/carry bags etc.

review.title: Great hotel for any traveler, business or leisure!
review.reviewText: This was an awesome place to stay! Beware of the parking fee.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee seemed a bit excessive.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to lots of city life and parks.

review.title: The restaurant is also excellent
review.reviewText: It is a very nice hotel, very friendly staff, very quiet (I can´t sleep at noisy hotels) so it was perfect, great, great location.
review.negativeRemarks: we ordered tickets prior to our arrival and they couldn´t find them, but the manager went with us to the stadium to have them re-printed.
review.locationRemarks: perfect location

review.title: Very central good quality hotel
review.reviewText: Very central and most places in walking distance. Very well kept hotel and pleasant restaurant. Only negative is they were the only hotel we stayed in who didn't give us a honeymoon treat. Don't let that put you off. San Fran is amazing and would come he again rather than NYC.
review.negativeRemarks: Only one bedside table.. it is not practical to share
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great exploration home base.
review.reviewText: From the northern midwest and came to San Fran to cool down for our 40th anniversary. Selected the Taj based on others' ratings and Union Square location, and the location is great! This was our first "luxury" hotel experience so nothing else to compare it to, but living space seemed adequate, a little more closet space would've been nice. Housekeeping service provided by very pleasant ghosts: rarely seen but room was always in excellent order whenever we returned from an outing. Used complimentary business center to check in & print boarding passes for flight home. Considering free WiFi's broad availability found the hotel's lack of this surprising & annoying. Also would've expected a conveniently available electrical outlet at each bedside for cell phone/tablet maintenance; ummm, it is the 21st century. Overall a very enjoyable experience.

review.title: Women travelers
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and refined. Quiet. Located in the heart of the downtown shopping core. All the staff make sure to remember your name and make you as comfortable as possible. For a women, traveling alone, I could not suggest a better hotel

review.title: Very enjoyable visit
review.reviewText: This is really a very good hotel and it is located central to everything in San Francisco room had a view of a brick wall

review.title: Friendly!
review.reviewText: Such a freindly staff! That really is the primary impression I have of the Taj. My room was very nicely decorated, modern but not stark or cold. It was not a large room, and if one equates space with luxury, you would not consider this a luxury property. However, it was clean and the furnishings were all in like-new condition. The bathroom was very nice, spacious, good shower. The room was also quiet. This is now on my list of places to look for in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Great location if you are a clothes horse and want to shop.

review.title: Book this hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel is unbelievable. It is quiet and luxurious. The rooms are adequate size for two people. The bathrooms are large with an oversized tub and shower. There are built in closets so you can hang your clothes up. The first night in our room we were given fresh fruit and water to welcome us. The hotel is at Union Square and is centrally located to shopping and public transportation. Public transportation is at the corner. The hotel dining room was wonderful. We ate breakfast once, the food was excellent and the service was not to be compared to anything, they take care to see that you have a perfect dining experience. Yes, expensive, that goes without saying for many luxurious hotel restaurants. There is a Starbucks on the corner if youre looking for a quick bite, or to save some money. If I ever go back to San Francisco, I will stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfort and quietness of it.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Superb location. Local to many restaurants, shopping and public transportation.

review.title: Great for couples
review.reviewText: Simple loved it!! The staff and service was great. One of. Est experiences. We've had. I would recommend this hotel in a minute to anyone visiting the area.

review.title: Great Hotel with Pricey Extras
review.reviewText: The room was on the small side, although superior in decoration and furnishings. The bathroom was plush and nearly as big as the bedroom. The room was so quiet you would not know it's an inner city hotel. Despite the luxurious feel, we felt nickel and dimed. Hotel parking is $57 a day, compared to $30 to $37 a day if you self park in a garage located an easy half block away. Internet and Wifi are $12.50 per day, per device. So we trudged our laptops to the Starbucks on the corner for free WiFi and a good sized cup of coffee. Even the economy motels in San Francisco advertise free WiFi. In room snacks and beverages were extremely expensive and only one cup of coffee per guest is complimentary. A pocket map of San Francisco was $7.50 and we were smart enough not to use it. Maps on the streets are free.
review.negativeRemarks: Pricey "extras"
review.locationRemarks: On Union Square

review.title: Great Hotel to Stay
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and clean hotel. Friendly services.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom is too big, and bedroom is little bit small.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!

review.title: Lovely..
review.reviewText: My stay was perfect..comfortable room, especially the bed. The only drawback was the lack of drawers to unpack my clothes into..my room had a closet with very limited shelf space. And the lighting in the area with the sinks is awful. I had to check my makeup in the elevator. Those are tiny things though..the room was very comfortable and I'd definately come again.
review.negativeRemarks: They almost charged me again although my room was prepaid. It was handled quickly once I pointed it out but it shouldn't have happened.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything!

review.title: Larry from Saskatchewan Canada loved the Taj
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel was just excellent, including the great location, a block from Union Square and some of the best shopping in North America. The staff were very accommodating and extremely polite. The restaurant was wonderful with a real variety of menu selections, my wife and I ate breakfast there every morning. If I had to name the best thing about the hotel, I would have to say the service, including the restaurant and lounge. If I return to San Francisco I will stay at the Taj Compton.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: perfect for a down town weekend. Everything within walking distance or a very short cab ride.

review.title: In town for the US Open
review.reviewText: Nice convenient location. Construction going on next door well past midnight. Front desk did relocate us though after voicing our concern. Would certainly rate this hotel 4+ but not 4.8. Some of the attention to details were missed by the staff. Turn down service nice in the evening. Expected more but was still pleased.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee only available 6:30AM-8:00AM daily in lobby
review.locationRemarks: Almost across the street from Union Square

review.title: A Gem Off Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is ideally located to Union Square. The common areas are comfortable and bright. It is a nice size for the facility to be intimate and for truly personal service from the staff. The rooms are a decent size, but do not go below Deluxe or it is tight for two people. The on-site restaurant is beautifully appointed and delicious. Try to get a package with breakfast included. It's a great value.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the staff - especially Dan and Edwin the doormen.
review.negativeRemarks: The closet is small and the drawer space is very limited. Unpacking can be difficult if you are staying more than two nights.
review.locationRemarks: Central location to museums, shopping and great restaurants. Short walk to the Ferry building.

review.title: Best hotel in SFO downtown
review.reviewText: Very clean and user friendly. One of best comfortable stay in SFO downtown. Keep it up.

review.title: Treated like Royalty!!!
review.reviewText:
Hands down, the Taj Campton beats out big name brand hotels!! Every single staff person was exceedingly helpful... from the desk and bell staff to the restaurant and housekeeping staff. They all did things that were unasked for in attempts of making our stay perfect! If they noticed we needed an extra luggage rack, they brought it. When we asked for restaurant recommendations, they had them AND made the reservations for us! I kept thinking that they were mistaking us for royalty or VIP's!

Secondarily, the location was perfect! Close to everywhere we wanted to go and to public transportation. No rental car needed. I would go back to San Francisco just to stay in this hotel!!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff and room appointments... plush robes, slippers, turn down service, etc!
review.negativeRemarks: Leaving!!
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and Chinatown.

review.title: Loved this hotel!!
review.reviewText: We went to SF over the memorial weekend. We were so happy with our hotel! It is very elegant & chic! I loved the location you walk out Union Square is in front of you, Chinatown is behind you. The trolley stop is a block away as our buses. The staff was very courteous & accommodating! Our bed was very comfortable, I will definitely come back to this hotel & recommend to family & friends. Enjoy!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, loved everything!
review.locationRemarks: Middle of Union Square

review.title: Memorial Taj Experience
review.reviewText:
The hotel wasn´t what I expected considering other past past experiences with Taj hotels in other countries. The hotel rooms were ok but nothing exceptional.
My experience with the morning concierge (Maria) recommendations wasn´t very good and in my opinion the hotel concierge should know more about restaurants r not recommend if she doesn't know. I had a better experience with the afternoon concierge Carlos and with the front desk personel as to recommendations.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge, rooms
review.locationRemarks: Bery good location Union Square

review.title: Great comfort.
review.reviewText: Staff and service were exceptional. More attention to detail needed on up keep of tv, mechanical systems, etc. Bed and bedding was awesome. Overall, very good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: TV
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location between Union Square and Nob Hill.

review.title: anniversary stay
review.reviewText: hotel is friendly, clean, and walking distance too all tourist attractions. We were surprise too be charged for wi-fi, considering the hotel rates.
review.negativeRemarks: no courtesy wi-fi, or breakfast
review.locationRemarks: walking distance too sites of interest

review.title: Great hotel for higher end tastes and budgets ...
review.reviewText:
Excellent location higher end hotel in the heart of union square. Room a bit on the smaller side but very clean and well maintained. Would not recommend for families with smaller children, better for couples or business travelers.

Also If you need to park while you are there and In/out is not important save a few $ by parking in the multi level garage across the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size
review.locationRemarks: Could not be better ... On the right side of union square (not in the lion a few blocks up)

review.title: Ideal for anyone seeking quality.
review.reviewText: This is my second stay at the Taj at Campton Place. Both times have been excellent. Its location is ideal and the hotel, with its small intimate atmosphere, provides an excellent respite from the bustle of Union Square. With a Starbucks next door and many quality restaurants in walking distance, I cannot think of a better location. The staff were universally friendly, well informed and genuinely happy to see me. While the rooms are small, the appointments are of the highest quality and very efficient. It will be my first choice for any trip to the City.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet was an extra charge.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping, eating and sightseeing within walking distance.

review.title: One of the best in S.F.
review.reviewText: All round, superb place to stay in San Francisco. Excellent dining choices and shopping all within walking distance. The staff was professional, polished and very pleasant.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect for being within walking distance to fabulous restaurants and shopping.

review.title: Thumbs up.
review.reviewText: Had a great stay in a comfortable, clean and well-appointed room. One of my better experiences in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: excellent bed and nice, comfortable bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: t.v. could have been bigger :)
review.locationRemarks: very convenient, off-union-square location

review.title: Perfect union square location
review.reviewText: Perfect location for union square shopping and cable car very close. Beds very nice. Bathroom very nice...only downside is the closet area needs more light! The gym was great because it is in the top floor and they keep a gigantic wall open to the outside! Would definitely return.

review.title: Don't like this hotel
review.reviewText:
Don't like that its totally non-smoking hotel.Very small rooms,not interesting interior,very expensive valet(50$ per day),expensive Internet(13$ per day).Location is in the downtown,a lot of poor and crazy people in this area.
Good point - many shops.
review.negativeRemarks: Doesn't worth money spent
review.locationRemarks: So so..

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText:
I like everything about this hotel
Small, high quality, great staff, nice rooms and terrific location
Food is very good too.
review.locationRemarks: terrific location for everything

review.title: Taj campton San fran
review.reviewText: No parking structure for guests. Hotel valet charges $57 a day. Parking structure around the area are $32 a night. The wifi service that was supposed to be "state of the art" was really slow. Room is mid size.
review.negativeRemarks: No parking and on and off internet that was overpriced.
review.locationRemarks: It's in the middle of the shopping district. Food is easy to find. Good location

review.title: Hard work looks effortless.
review.reviewText: As head of hospitality at Iron Horse Vineyards it is wonderful to find a hotel that gives me the same high quality of hospitality I hope I give my guests.
