I do not have the responsibility of a hotel. Taj Campton does much more than I do. Their hard work for a guest looks effortless. A wonderful attribute for your comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: Waiting for the car
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect for Down Town, China Town, Walking is easy and wonderful for food, shopping,theater, siteseeing San Francisco.

review.title: Taj San Francisco
review.reviewText: Taj is one of those iconic brands that I count on for a wonderful lodging experience throughout the world. They just seem to make you feel you have arrived at your own special place. From the moment of arrival at curbside thru departure the Taj staff never disappoints. Our last stay was no different.

review.title: Luxury on Union Square
review.reviewText: We loved staying at the Taj. A special treat for my husband's birthday. Wish we could have stayed longer. The only very small complaint was the rooms were small but considering our location right on Union Square I would say we got a very good value.
review.positiveRemarks: robes and slippers, delicious fancy breakfast!
review.negativeRemarks: smallish rooms
review.locationRemarks: perfect right on Union Square!

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: The thing I'll remember most about my experience at the Taj Compton is the exemplary service by all staff members. Everyone was extremely polite and helpful. My room was tiny, very cute, and very clean. My only complaint is that there was no bathtub but the shower was nice and large. The location of the hotel is perfect- 30 seconds to Union Square, 2 mins to Chinatown, 10 mins from Asian Art Museum. I parked my car when I arrived and didn't need it until I left. All in all, it was an absolutely fabulous experience and I will definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was extremely kind and efficient.
review.negativeRemarks: There was no bathtub in my room.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location- right off Union Square.

review.title: xmas excellence
review.reviewText: Excellent throughout. Excellent location. The hotel was excellent compared to some in the price range. Room was to the rear but other than that no problems at all.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel is well maintained, rooms are comfortable and the staff is excellent. The restaurant and bar are expensive when compared to other options.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText:
Staff is friendly
Carlo the concierge was super helpfull to help us for directions and tours of city.
Modern room
Restorant has great breakfast
Location is very central : perfect if you like to walk
No dissapointments!

review.title: San Francisco - Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel for a conference last week and it is a very nice hotel. Extremely comfortable beds. Nice size room. Everyone was very nice up front. Gym was very nice. Within walking distance of almost everything. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Too expensive for what you get...
review.reviewText: The room maintainance was not good...shower didn't work right, light bulb burnt out twice, rubber around window loose with air and noise entering... They ask too much for what you get...based mianly on loaction which is good...but there are other hotels in the area.

review.title: Taj
review.reviewText:
Great location, hotel restaurant, and staff.
i do feel that the current paint job was cheap paint and poor to average quality of work.

review.title: The good, the bad, and the ugly
review.reviewText:
Good: Most of the staff are pleasant. Housekeeping was pretty strong, although they left dirty coffee cups in my room and I had to call to have clean ones brought in. The hotel is attractive and the Union Square location is convenient if you're interested in shopping or being in that area.

Bad: They nickle and dime you. Internet is $12.50 per day, with no break if you're there for a lengthy stay. They have a coffee machine in the room, but charge you $2.25 for each Nespresso pod you put in the machine. The doormen open the door for you no more than 20% of the time.

Ugly: I booked and pre-paid for a Deluxe room and was placed in a Standard ("California") room, which is a smaller unit on the lower floors. After I complained, I was moved to a Deluxe room, but the street noise was pretty bad. If you're a very sound sleeper, it won't matter. If not, maybe book elsewhere--and make sure they give you the room level you paid for. Please note that they were quite precise in charging for the Nespresso pods, but management never apologized or offered me anything for putting me in a lower class of room for several nights.

There's a Starbucks right next door, so you can have coffee there. And, there's a really upscale food center in the Westfield Mall on Market St. about 5 minutes away. They have the Slanted Door outpost and a range of other food options.

review.title: "Best location for San Francisco stay"
review.reviewText:
Great staff, warm and friendly.
Modern room and very comfortable.
My stay was short but I would definitely come back to these guys again in the future.

review.title: A Great San Francisco Treat!
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful hotel located on Union Square. Excellent service and a very helpful, friendly staff. The rooms are well appointed and quite comfortable. Great location. You can walk to all the restaurants and stores you need. The only negative is the cost of parking you car. As with all of the hotels in downtown S.F., it is quite expensive. However, you are a block from all of the popular public transportation choices. We enjoyed this hotel very much and look forward to returning.

review.title: best service ever
review.reviewText: loved this place; the service was lovely and staff responded wonderfullly to our every whim; pricey, but worth it; could use a little spiffing up

review.title: Taj Campton Place is great!
review.reviewText: Taj Campton Place is a great hotel. When I checked in, the receptionist greeted me by name, even though I've never been there before! The room was nice, the king bed was very comfortable! Everything was nicely laid out and clean. Had a great dinner in the restaurant with a business colleague. A little pricey, but the food was wonderful. And the service was impeccable. Only complaint is that I was there on business, so didn't have much time to enjoy the hotel or the city. Definitely will go back and stay at this hotel.

review.title: Great Service from Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: I picked Taj Campton for it's proximity to work I had in San Francisco. The hotel was perfectly fine, but he service stood out as excellent. The doorman, the desk clerk and even the maintenance person replacing a light bulb, were all friendly and courteous. But the best part was that with very little time to research our dining options, each recommendation we received for dining was top rate.

review.title: would definitely go back
review.reviewText: great location and excellent service

review.title: Taj Campton was Awesome!
review.reviewText: Wonderful San Francisco Hotel! We'd definitely stay here again.

review.title: Best service ever!
review.reviewText: My fiancee and I stayed for four days around New Years Eve and had a marvelous experience. Laura at the front desk was charming and friendly, as well as efficient. Paul, our waiter in the Hotel restaurant, which was fabulous, was a fantastic server. Big positive impressions were made by Dan the Doorman. He alone made the stay great. What a pro and a peach of a person. Our time at the Taj Campton was unforgettable--I highly recommend it to one and all!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel exceeded our expectations. Rooms were great even though on the small size. Service was excellent. Location was just off Union Square so very convenient. Recommend highly.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel in a Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Great service. The rooms are small, but very nice. The location of the hotel is perfect! We will stay here again next time we visit San Francisco.

review.title: Best hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText:
Loved this hotel, it simply couldn't be beat in San Francisco. It had the perfect location right in Union Square. Perfectly safe walking distance from all shopping, the Moscone center, and plenty of AMAZING restaurants!

Definitely will stay here on my next trip.

review.title: We loved it!!
review.reviewText: Right on Union Square, wonderful, helpful staff. This hotel could not have been better. We loved Dan the doorman!!!

review.title: Great location and great hotel
review.reviewText: was very happy with our stay. the parking was expensive and I would have loved an impromptu upgrade, but everything was very nice and the location is perfect.

review.title: Ideal for us
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. Ideal location near Union Square. The important things for us are a comfortable bed and a quiet room, both of these were provided. Very helpful staff, room was bigger than I expected. I can think if no downsides.

review.title: Very Pleased picky guest
review.reviewText:
The room was very nice. Large tiled bathrooms, very clean. Bedroom on the smaller side but not as issue as there were only 2 of us. Room was very comfortable and nice. Bed extremely comfy. Turn down service pleasant. Hotel on the quiet side. Lovely people.
If we had to make one complaint it was that we couldn't get any pillows other than feather and they are just to soft for my sleep comfort.
Great breakfast restaurant next block over Sears City Cafe.
Hotel location good if you are looking to be on union square.

review.title: Will stay here every time!
review.reviewText: Although I booked the smallest room, it was spectacular. Comfy, attractive and with a great bathroom (separate tub and shower). Nice work-out facility. We'll be back every time.

review.title: Great service and location
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel in excellent location off Union Square. Service was great and prompt. Helpful concierge. Loved the complimentary bowl of fruit on arrival and nightly turn down service.

review.title: Taj Campton Review
review.reviewText: The hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed in, but I give it only a "very good" rating. The reason is that at their prices, I was expecting a superlative hotel, with exceptional services and quality. Nothing specific, just an overall empression. One example is that many hotels offer a chocolate on the pillow after evening bed turn-down service - this was not offered.

review.title: for the price there must be a better value
review.reviewText: rooms are too small

review.title: Would go back anytime
review.reviewText: Excellent service and ambiance. Food in Hotel is awesome. Concierge was superb. Would recommend highly.

review.title: Taj Campton a San Francisco treat
review.reviewText:
Excellent service, very clean and modern rooms, room service wonderful, dining room wonderful/fabulous service! Concierge
was terrific, helped us with so much touring around town! Very nice hotel, 5 star

review.title: Lovely hotel in great location!
review.reviewText: his is a lovely hotel and in a fab location, right on Union Square. We had booked a deluxe king room and having looked on the hotel website was expecting a large room with a chaise long and a separate walk-in shower. However, we were given a smaller room (no chaise long) with a shower over the bath (and barely enough wardrobe space for one person's clothing, let alone two). I rang down to reception and explained that the room wasn't as expected. I was told that all the rooms were of different specifications but that they would check availability for another deluxe king room. Within minutes reception rang back and said they would be sending someone up to show us another room. This room was exactly as shown and described on the website, so we moved our luggage and checked into the room. The wardrobe space was more than double that of the previous room and the room itself was so much bigger. And the bathroom, well I could have happily lived in there! A walk-in shower (as expected!) by the side of the bath and the bath also had a shower head by the taps which could be pulled out and lengthened when needed. The room was cleaned daily and the bed turned down at night. Everything was spotless. The bed was really comfortable, although we did spot a stack of books underneath it which appeared to be holding it up in the middle!! However, we wouldn't have known this had we not seen them. One thing to be aware of is that tea/coffee in the room is charged at $2 each!

review.title: Nice but over-priced
review.reviewText:
Beautiful rooms, well-appointed gym, great location, great hotel restaurant, but way over-priced! $10 for a bowl of breakfast cereal??? Word to the fiscally-wise: DO NOT EAT HERE! Walk around the neighborhood and you'll stumble across some nice places for breakfast/lunch.

Also, when will hotels realize that internet access should be free??? At this price point, one expects a few more amenities -- not everyone who stays here is on an expense account.

review.title: Union Square Get Away!
review.reviewText: Couldn't have been better. Everything was wonderfull.

review.title: great small hotel
review.reviewText: service was exceptional, location great, would saty again

review.title: Honeymoon Getaway
review.reviewText: Love, love, love this hotel. It couldn't be in a better location. Prime area for all of your shopping desires. Macy's, Neiman's, Saks, etc., right outside your front door. Really clean and safe area. We took a tour of the city on one of those double-decker buses and the pick up location was just 1 block from the hotel. Very convenient. China town was only 2 blocks away. It was really nice to be able to walk everywhere We would have walked to dinner EVERY night, but I was in heels, so my poor little feet couldn't make the 2-block walk. It was only a $4 cab ride though. =) -- The hotel staff was simply amazing and the maid service was impeccable. No sooner did we leave the hotel, did we come back to a clean and perfect room. We can't wait to go back. The boutique nature of the hotel is what makes it so wonderful and so desirable. You always get greeted by your name.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The service was exceptional and we were treated like VIP guests the entire stay. Upon our check in, the guest service rep asked if it was okay that the manger escorted us up to our room. Sure, why not. After settling into our room, we received a complimentary plate of fruit and a large bottle of water. That was a very nice and welcomed surprise. My fiance and I had a California King room which was small but suited our needs just fine since we didn't spend a lot of time there. The furnishings were very tasteful and had relaxed feel. The only complaint I had about the room was we were facing the alley, and I was woken up almost every night by a truck at 4AM. I live in a city though, so it wasn't that big of a deal since I'm accustomed to city noises. The location cannot be beat! We were a block from Union Square which was very convenient. We would definitely stay at the Campton Place again!

review.title: Average San Fran 4.5 star
review.reviewText: Average experience for a 4 1/2 star hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, would absolutely stay here again

review.title: fabulous coffee service at campton place courtesy of mr. espresso in oakland, california
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at Campton Place several times but this time it was better than ever- the room was lovely and the beds were extremely comfortable. The room service was excellent and super speedy.

we have a coffee company in maui hawaii, and good coffee in the morning is a deal breaker for us. much to our surprise, the hotel served coffee in french presses- small, medium, and large. they also had a choice of at least five different types and they were all delicious. and for the tea drinkers amongst us, they had an enormous selection of black, green, herbal and decaffeinated teas. truly amazing. I WISH THAT I COULD MOVE IN AND STAY THERE FOREVER!

review.title: Nice quiet place to start or end your business day
review.reviewText: The feather bed is a dream -soft and cozy and warm. I slept like a baby. The dressing area and bathroom are inviting and well laid out, making morning grooming or evening wind-down a pleasure. I actually took a bubble bath one evening just to relax, which I hadn't done in years. The only things missing were candles and a companion - neither of which I can reasonably expect the hotel to provide. The hotel restaurant is small but elegant. I found myself dressing up just to go eat. Very good food and service. The overall atmosphere of the hotel is quiet and (again) elegant. Overall service was attentive and non-intrusive. Not a particularly social atmosphere, and if I weren't sleeping, dressing or eating, I could find no compelling reason to remain in my room or in the hotel. Right in the heart of Union Square, surrounded by other 4-star and 5-star hotels and great shopping venues. Depending on your tastes, this could be a nearly ideal place for business travelers to unpack their bags. Might even suit the tastes of couples, but probably for families with kids more suitable accommodations exist.

review.title: San Francisco most convenient hotel to downtown area
review.reviewText: The Campton hotel is a wonderful boutique hotel located in the heart of San Francisco's downtown area. Location is very close to shopping, dining, and theatre. Their service at this hotel is excellent and the staff was very accomodating. We were not impressed with the food quailty when compared to the price at the hotel's restaurant. We ate at many other restaurants in the area which delivered much higher quality as well as economical.

review.title: As Always, Loved Campton Place
review.reviewText: This was my 3rd visit to Campton Place since it became a Taj Hotel. Everything about the stay was perfect: space, view, storage, bed/bedding, amenities. We always order room service continental breakfast that, while pricey, is a wonderful, relaxing way to start a morning in San Francisco. We will definitely be back, and the sooner the better!

review.title: Great Holiday Stay
review.reviewText:
The hotel provided great service and attention. Room was very clean and contemporary. We decided to stay at the hotel to be close to Union Square and holiday shopping. Had a wonderful experience.

The staff was very accommodating and friendly. The only problem we experienced was during check out. We called for a bellhop for baggage assistance and waited for 20 minutes without anyone arriving. We finally carried our bags down ourselves (which we would normally do, but we had quite a few bags). We had someplace to be and were short on time. The staff was apologetic. Overall, not a big deal.

We will definitely stay again next Holiday Season.

review.title: Lovely stay
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Love the quality linens and mattress. We went to the Wynn in Las Vegas afterwards and found ourselves disappointed that they were not as good. The staff were nice and helpful. Great food. The only thing I wished was different was the gym, it's an outdoor one. Even though the top was covered, the surrounding area was exposed to the outside, which would be great if the weather was not 50 degrees. But I had a good run anyway since the set up was perfect with the TV and before I knew it, I was warmed up.

review.title: A sanctuary amongst the chaos
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay during the first week of November even though it was disrupted by the constant noise of labor picketing from across the street at the Grand Hyatt. Campton Place is a quiet sanctuary from all of the hustle and bustle of a busy city. You are greeted by one, and sometimes two, doormen who welcome you into and out of the hotel. My room was very cozy and comfortable. I took Bart from the airport and back. This was my first attempt at doing this and it was a breeze,cheap, and fast, only $8.10 each way.

review.title: Wished I could have stayed longer.
review.reviewText: We came to SF for the Women's Marathon to be there for our daughter who ran it. The staff was all extremely courteous especially the doorman who was the best! The breakfast in the resturant in the lobby was one of the best we had that weekend.

review.title: Great Hotel for anyone with business on or around Union Square
review.reviewText: I have stayed across the street at the Grand Hyatt several times, and would recommend this hotel over the Hyatt. The staff was unbelievable, the room was great, the bathroom was big and nice. The room service breakfast was way too much for one person, but it was fun to try.

review.title: Would stay at Campton Place in a heart beat?
review.reviewText: The hotels location is fantastic. You can walk to the cable cars, shopping, dinning and much more. The room was very clean, comfortable and the staff was very accommodating to our request. The air condition went out for a few hours but our room was still quite comfortable. We had several problems with the room (bathtub drain did not work, iron was cracked). The hotel staff responded quickly to fix these issues and we ended up having a very enjoyable stay.

review.title: Favorite downtown hotel to date
review.reviewText: Rooms are very nicely sized for a downtown hotel; location excellent just off Union Square; staff and service excellent. I would definitely return.

review.title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel - Hot Night in SF
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at this San Francisco gem. Staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Hotel and room was clean and beautiful. Record heat in the city was our only complaint, as the room was warmer than I liked at night. I'm sure this is hardly ever a problem. Location is ideal for Union Square shopping and restaurants. I've stayed at other 4 and 5 star hotels in SF and I'd stay here again above all others but one - and the rate for the one above it is almost double.

review.title: San Fransisco top Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed for 4 nights and have to say we were extremley pleased with the hotel. It is 100 yards from Union Square in the heart of the city. The thing that pleased us the most was the friendlyness of the staff. Each morning we were greeted by name by cheerful staff. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to other travellers.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Everything was nice...especially the service and attitudes of the staff---very friendly, very professional.

review.title: Super clean rooms
review.reviewText: The room was super clean and I have to admit that I have never seen a cleaner room any other hotel that I ever stayed in. The only problem with this hotel is that majority of the rooms won't offer any view and you basically get stock with a room which overlooks a dark alley. Overall I enjoyed staying in this hotel because most of the time you are out and the only time you come in is at night time to sleep. So if you are planning to stay in all day in your room this hotel is definately a wrong choice for you.

review.title: Nice hotel in great location. I will definitely go back.
review.reviewText: The hotel was smaller and a little hidden away compared to the bigger chain hotels, but it was very nice. I didn't utilize any of the services, other than the fitness center, since I was out most of the day. As far as location - it is a great location. Right off Union Square, on the same block as Niketown and other shopping. One block from the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. My room was on a lower floor so no view to speak of; but it was a really nice room with large bathroom, tub and shower. The overall feel of the room more than made up for the lack of a view.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Honestly couldn't find a single thing to complain about. We had a great visit. The staff was excellent, the hotel was clean, it was a very comfortable visit. If I had to be really really picky, I would say the overnight parking is on the high side. If they could include it in the price of the room (bump the price up a little) It would easily be worth it. I would like to visit again and stay longer!

review.title: Highest reommendation
review.reviewText: Impeccable service. Gorgeous facility. Attentive to every detail. And friendly!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice quiet hotel right in the middle of union square. The rooms are very clean and very comfortable. The staff and service is exceptional.

review.title: Beautiful oasis in Union Square
review.reviewText: Campton Place is a beautiful oasis in the heart of Union Square. Elegant, quiet and wonderful service.

review.title: TOP CLASS
review.reviewText: Frequent this hotel's restaraunt on a regular basis. Spotted a 'bargain' room rate on Expedia and grabbed it. I cannot describe my experience as anything but outstanding. The staff, from front desk to the bar, are exemplary, extremely pleasant and helpful. Had the honor of meeting the GM, who is a gentleman. I have traveled the world and this is one of the best hotels I have stayed in.

review.title: A Great Place to Stay!
review.reviewText: I just returned from a short holiday in San Francisco. I stayed at the Campton Place for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. I chose this hotel because of its location and ranking and reviews on Expedia (which I will try not to duplicate as most are reflective of my experience as well). As a solo traveler the staff at this hotel certainly made me feel welcome. From the gentlemen at the front door, the concierge, the front desk staff and the maid service (including evening turn down service) everyone was friendly and helpful. It was nice to return to the hotel after a day of touring and be welcomed back by name. The location is excellent for shopping and central to trolley and street car service. I hope to get back to San Francisco and look forward to returning to the Campton Place Hotel!

review.title: Use for business
review.reviewText: I would use this for my next business trip. I might book a different hotel for my next leisure trip.

review.title: Wah! Taj
review.reviewText: After all its a Taj Property we do not expect anything less & certainly did not get anything less than expected. You go back in time to the splendor & opulence & hospitality of the Maharajas but with all the modern facilities

review.title: Senstional, if you can afford it!
review.reviewText: Luckily we stayed four nights over the low period after Christmas...first impression of the most beautiful glowing red seasonal decorations in the lobby. Truly the most helpful and utterly charming concierge ever. Rooms very luxurious, superb bed and bedding,sybaritic bathroom. Distinctive 'European luxury' hotel attention to detail. Only disappointment the restaurant, pompous, patronising slow service, the end product rather mediocre food, overpriced,in an uninspiring setting, more fun to eat in the bar. Perfectly located a step from buzzing Union Square.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I stayed on the fifth floor, but the water pressure in the shower was very weak. Despite booking a "deluxe" room, I got a room with essentially no view and next to (i) the elevator, (ii) ice-making machine AND (iii) storage room for room service, while the hotel did not seem to be fully booked. I had to remind the front desk to get my morning newspaper. Also, room would not typically be cleaned and serviced until later in a day. The only thing I liked was bed, which was comfortable.

review.title: Highly recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: While my stay was brief (one night) I thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. High points were quality of room appointments and efficiency ofthe staff. I would happily return

review.title: Excellence!!
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at the Campton Place hotel during our vacation the first week of August. We enjoyed everything. The ambiance, the service, the hotel was everything and more than we could have ever asked for. We HIGHLY recommend this hotel for those who are visiting the San Francisco area. The location in union square was perfrect. Definatley the center of the upscale shopping mecca: Tifanny and Co, Macy's, Armani, Louis Vuitton, Coach, etc. We will definatley be staying at the Campton Place on our next visit!!

review.title: Great little hotel!
review.reviewText: I had never stayed at a Taj hotel before, and was thoroughly impressed. The room was modern and had one of the best uses of space I've seen in a hotel. All services from front desk to housekeeping were very courteous and paid great attention to detail. The evening bed turn-down service was the best I have seen. I liked seeing a good array of Indian TV channels in addition to full US cable. I definitely recommend this hotel and will look forward to staying at Taj hotels in the future.

review.title: Staff equalled the GREAT, convenient location along with a really great spacious room!
review.reviewText: I was searching for a convenient location to Union Square. I didn't want the best but wanted a "good" experience. I got a "great" experience. With the exception of one minor slip of a front desk person, our entire stay could not have been better. The entire staff was so friendly and helpful with our every need. They went out of their way to cater to our every wish. We couldn't have been happier!

review.title: Great Value for Money Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I just cant fault the hotel as a place to stay in SF. It is an ideal location, has superb rooms at very good prices and the service and staff are excellent.

review.title: Will be back to stay again
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a few days while moving daughter to bay area for college. Will make this hotel my "base" when I visit my daughter in the future. Loved the hotel, especially the very helpful staff. They went above and beyond to help us.

review.title: Heavenly Hotel
review.reviewText: This is the most beautiful hotel! The staff was very professional and went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. The room was beautiful with pillow top beds and feather pillows and comforter. We had turn down service each night and they left us chocolates, bottled water and put slippers on each side of the bed. We will definitely stay here next time we visit San Francisco!

review.title: Lovely experience
review.reviewText: This is among the best hotel experiences of my life. The bed was incredibly plush and comfortable, the tub was deep, and the furnishings were lovely. Furthermore, the staff were incredibly friendly and professional. I particularly loved the bed turndown each evening. I absolutely will seek out Campton Place when I return to San Francisco.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at Campton place in april, the experience was so wonderful, the hotel is excellent and chic. We have been in other hotels of the leading hotels of the world and as always the service was outstanding. The room beautiful, the restaurant and the food excellent and the service of all personnel in general extremely polite and professional. Excellent just excellent. We recommend this hotel without any doubt.

review.title: Elegant and Refined
review.reviewText: Top notch amenities and location.

review.title: impressed by service
review.reviewText: the staff was attentive and cordial. the rooms were bright and modern. the moulton brown soaps were first rate. when i had a problem with tv reception the hotel sent engineering to fix and then quickly changed rooms to assure me of watching a championship basketball game without delay. the ny times delivered and the overall condition of the hotel was excellent.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel! Great location!

review.title: The best concierge in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The room was extremely clean and comfortable! Hands down the most knowledgeable concierge in San Francisco... Hotel was walking distance to great shopping, restaurants and clubs! Perfect:)

review.title: Luxurious Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel situated in the heart of Union Square. Staff is very friendly upon check-in and extremely accomodating. The sheets on the bed were Italian linens and some of the softest I have ever felt. The bar was very expensive but excellent quality wines and food. glasses of wine are between $15-$20 each. We had in room massages, which we do not recommend unless you are either a business traveler or desperate. The standard king room was tight for one massage table making it difficult for the therapist to walk around the table. In room massage for two isn't possible unless you have a large suite. Furthermore, the quality of the massage therapists just isn't up to par with other spas in SF.

review.title: Charming Rooms
review.reviewText: The rooms were comfortable and the bed was absolutly like sleeping in a cloud. The location is great, walking distance all around Union Square. However, I was put on a smoking floor without asking for one and not told so untill I woke up at 3 AM from the smell of smoke! When I mentioned this to the front desk personnel, no one seemed to care.

review.title: The Most Amazing Trip EVER!
review.reviewText: Well I am 21 and decided to have a romantic weekend with my boyfriend in the city. So we stayed at the Campton Place Hotel and had a deluxe King Room and the room was amazing. The location of the hotel is litterally almost on union square; well actually union square is a block to the left of the hotel. But the location was amazing because I loveee shopping and I didnt have to walk far to drop off all my bags! But as far as the service, it was IMPECCABLE! I seriously felt like a spoiled princess, anything we needed they took care of and quickly at that. One night my boyfriend decided to book us in room swedish massages and he made this decision at 7pm that night. Well the front desk concierge called around and within in 45 minutes we had a couples in room massage booked for 8:30pm that same night. To top it all off both of our massage tables wouldnt fit in our room so the hotel opened up the room next to us for me to have my massage in. Overall I had an amazing time at the Campton place I would DEFINATELY recommend that hotel to anyone looking for a hotel to share a romantic weekend with their lover/boyfriend/husband/wife/whatever!, because it was perfect for that!!

review.title: Pretty Impressed
review.reviewText: The only thing missing is the flat screen good cable. Bathroom was awesome.

review.title: Going Back Monthly
review.reviewText: I travel 3-4 nights a week and it's fabulous when you can find a place where you forget you're on business and actually enjoy being away from home. Molton Brown products, terrific bed, extremely quiet, very service oriented, housekeeping staff is friendly and professional. I've now made this my hotel in San Francisco and look forward to returning every few weeks!

review.title: It is one of the best in SFO
review.reviewText: They have very good service, rooms, beds, pillows, bathroom, and resturant services. The orange juice at breakfast is really extraordinary. In the center of the town.

review.title: a nice boutique hotel
review.reviewText: very conveniently located. very satisfied with the quality of services.

review.title: Romantic Stay
review.reviewText: Clean,quiet and well worth the price. Close to shopping in Union Square. I will return both for business and pleasure.

review.title: An great boutique hotel
review.reviewText: The service was great and the room was well appointed. They also have Molton Brown products, which is a bonus.

review.title: A great property I didn't know about before
review.reviewText: I had a great experience at this hotel - booked at the last minute for an unexpected personal night in SF at the end of a business trip and chose by rate more than anything. The location can't be beat, my room was very comfortable and quiet, and the staff was extra friendly. Loved the Molton Brown products. Only tiny thing was the desk in my roon was a bit small (still had to do a bit of work) - but the bed was super comfortable so it was a great place to stay - I'd definitely stay there again.

review.title: Large and lovely rooms
review.reviewText: Bath is large and beautiful: front desk staff was lovely. Unfortunately I think our discount rate probably resulted in us having a room with no view - which was disappointing...but overall, lovely room!

review.title: It was nice !!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were sooo nice and it was perfect spot for waking around downtown everything was in walking distance !!!... The hotel was somewhat old but very clean and the beds were very comfortable

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: I called because I would be checking in late and they said that it was no problem at all. When I got in around 11:30pm they were ready to take my bags. Check-in was very easy and took very little time. The room (California King)was very nice with separate tub and shower. Over all there was a lot of space in the bathroom and the main room itself. It was very comfortable and my wife and I loved staying here. My only complaint would have been that the room smelled slightly of stale smoke even though I asked for a non-smoking room. I turned out to not bother us enough to bother as we were just staying a short time.

review.title: A touch of luxury, a quiet hotel and a comfortable bed
review.reviewText: While not garish or overwhelming, this hotel was a treat - refined, tasteful and very comfortable. It was perfectly situated off of Union Square, and our room (facing the side) was very quiet. The bed and bedding was extremely comfortable - hadn't slept this long or deeply in years! The front desk, concierge and doormen were very attentive, upbeat and professional.

review.title: Hotel & staff are superb!
review.reviewText: Lovely property. Concierge and other staff members we dealt with were exceptional!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: One word - Bose. How many hotels have Bose radios in the room - that's how classy they are.

review.title: Somewhat disappointing
review.reviewText: A very elegant hotel with an excellent restaurant and perhaps an even better bar, but the room itself had some problems. For example, the bathroom had no fan, and there was a partial glass plate in the tub that also served as a shower but no shower curtain. The plug in the tub also didn't work so it filled as you showered. The room itself was a bit bare (one picture on the wall) and the furnishings did not seem to live up to the general elegance of the hotel. We may just have had a particularly problematic room, but that shouldn't happen at this level. On the positive side, the location off Union Square was perfect and the service throughout was excellent. I think I would try other hotels before returning, but I would definitely recommend the bar as a stopover while shopping around Union Square.

review.title: Not!
review.reviewText: There may be nice rooms/hallways/etc...ours wasn't.

review.title: Definite Refferal
review.reviewText: The service was absolutely 10/10! The location is also 10/10. The small "things" that make a hotel great, rather than good, are all covered at this boutique hotel! I will definitely stay at this hotel again while in SF for either business or leisure! Great Job!

review.title: Terrible Room Service
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel, except for the terrible food we ordered for room service ($65 for a sandwich, bowl of soup, and 3 cookies). It really had no taste.

review.title: Relaxing, Elegant, But Comfortable
review.reviewText: Wonderful room with elegant touches, but not over the top or too formal. Mostly clean lines with a European touch, but not too trendy. The bed was comfortable, the bath was great. I liked having the closet in the bath so your room could be very uncluttered. All in all the room felt like you were staying in an elegant, private room, not a hotel. My biggest complaint is the room safe could not hold a laptop. I find that to be a problem.

review.title: Perfect - elegant, simple, well located
review.reviewText: We really liked this hotel. In fact, this is the first time I actually bother to send in a review.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Excellent choice of places to stay in San Francisco. Directly across the street from Union Square and shopping. Very clean, comfortable and quiet. The only negative was we had a rental car and it cost $45.00 to keep it at the hotel overnight ... I thought that was overpriced!

review.title: 1st time
review.reviewText: Everything was pretty good, except they don't have a business center. Supposedly they're "working on it". Resolved the issue by loaning us a laptop.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our weekend in San Francisco. The location was great very close to all transportation. No need for a car. The rooms were small but very comfortable.

review.title: Just OK, not Great
review.reviewText: We had high expectations for this hotel given the cost. The room was a bit small and not well lit. The shower was poorly designed creating a flood every time it was used -- the soaking tub, however, was wonderful. The location was excellent for shopping but we had to take taxis to the restaurants and other attractions we had chosen. The service was friendly and efficient, as expected in an upscale hotel. The bed was not that comfortable and the nightclub on Campton kept us awake for two nights. The room was very, very clean and the decor, toiletries, sheets, robes and slippers were lovely.

review.title: Such a relaxing way to spending a weekend in a hectic city!
review.reviewText: My husband and I loved the hotel... we didn't want to leave our room knowing that outside our walls were the bustling street, and crowds everywhere. The design of our room was top notch, with only the best used. Room service was exceptional.

review.title: Unbelievable stay!
review.reviewText: Stayed at Campton Place for one night and it was incredible. The room is exceptionally decorated. The robes were so soft and the feather bed was the topper. Service was exceptional as well. Location is great and would definitely stay there again if I am in SF.

review.title: Can't wait to go back again
review.reviewText: At this hotel, it's heavenly when you sleep and rest on the bed. I have never stayed at a hotel where the bed is as comfortable as my tempurpedic bed. Also, I always requested rooms away from elevators and commom areas. On our floor, we only had three rooms including ours. Yep, yep, yep, I would do it again!

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: Rooms were nice. Service was marginal. Few question we asked about the area, restraunts etc. they seemed confused. For the price I expected more

review.title: Lovely hotel and cheerful service
review.reviewText: Beautiful quiet room in the heart of Union Squrae. Room on small side but we didn't care. Would've been nice to have a bathtub but we won't quibble. Excellent service from reception and bellman. Restaurant a bit expensive.

review.title: Tiny rooms, no view
review.reviewText: I was excited to find Expedia had a last minute 50% discount on the rate so we checked it out. While the service and details are great, the bedroom was really small with a little window looking right into another building. I don't mean across the road, I mean right next to, no road in between. I made the room very dark and really like light. The bed was great, but definitely not worth the regular rate in my opinion. You can stay across the street with huge window and light, without the level of service for a lot less. Depends what you like.

review.title: Great get away
review.reviewText: Although the room was not that large, we found it to be extremely nice. The twice daily maid service with turn down service in the evening was a plus. The bell staff were very helpful and professional. We also appreciated the free bottled water which we took with us while sight seeing. I don't think this would have been a place for our kids, but being alone for our anniversary was perfect.

review.title: Great Staff. Generally Good Hotel w/ Some Notable Lapses
review.reviewText: The staff is, without exception, gracious, welcoming, friendly and efficient. Couldn't have felt more at home! We had a "California" room. Fabulous beds & linens! Room not large but adequate. Bathroom oversized but not well thought-out. Shower head way too high on wall for my wife and was non-adjustable. Poor lighting in bathroom. Ridiculous (and sharp-edged) grab socket to open door from inside. Very uncomfortable and difficult. Don't know who came up with that idea. Loose "something" rattling in ceiling whenever the hotel's main exhaust system was on kept us awake. Engineering couldn't find the problem. Room design was more for looks than function. We go to San Francisco specifically to eat! Hotel's restaurant not worth a second visit. Staff was pleasant. Commis staff was efficient in the extreme...absolutely great! Good sommelier and cellar. But the food was lackluster to say the least. Beautifully presented but that's where it ends. With the exception of one sauce and one soup it was mediocre at best. One dish, the white asparagus, was truly awful. We are fatigued with restaurants charging huge prices and failing to deliver the goods. We don't mind, in the least, paying for outstanding quality, but for $300 per couple plus gratuity, every dish had better be memorable. The meal prompted my wife to quip that it was "...all foam and no substance".

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Overall, our experience was excellent! The hotel is very convenient to public transportation and is walking distance to Union Square and Chinatown. We were greeted warmly and received an upgrade without asking. The front desk and bellmen were very helpful with directions and restaurant suggestions. The room was clean, comfortable, quiet, and spacious. I would definitely recommend it!

review.title: Great hotel, but concierge services questionable
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Campton Place for 3 nights Apr 27th - Apr 29th. The hotel itself is very impressive. Each floor only has a handful of rooms which makes for a nice, quiet atmosphere. Our only complaint was the concierge services. It seemed like there was only one person on staff that could ever help us on any given day. One day we called the concierge away from the hotel to set up a lunch reservation for the next day and got set up at the wrong restaurant. When we called back we were told that the concierge would check into it and call us back. We never did hear back from the hotel. We ended up calling ourselves. Very disappointing considering how much this hotel charges! One other note, the day we left there was a permit in the window indicating that the hotel would be changing ownership. I'm not sure how that will impact the hotel. Nonetheless, the hotel itself is great. It is located right at Union Square and near the trolley lines. We would stay there again.

review.title: wonderful personal service
review.reviewText: I found all the staff, from the doorman to the housekeeper, pleasant and helpful - they knew my name by the time I returned a few hours after checkng in. All in all, a beautiful place with impeccable service. Rooms were very comfortable and quiet.

review.title: Great value high quality xcellent locatione
review.reviewText: Had a great 'shopping' stay at this hotel. Service was excellent. Room was beautifully decorated but a bit on the small sid We dined in the restaurant -the server was very knowledgeable and helpful - great wines. Bistro was nice too. Would definitely go back to this hotel

review.title: Very Comfortable
review.reviewText: The bed, pillows and linens were the best and most comfortable I've experienced in a long while. The furnishings and decor were all well done. It was clean, without question. The staff was very accomodating and took care of special requests and situations without fail. I can't wait to stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Campton Place is in a great location -- right near everything, and it's on Union Square. It's within walking distance to Chinatown, and it's in a great location that's not really hilly. The hotel was a good value for the money, with a spacious room and the bed was super comfortable -- one of the best I've ever slept on. I wanted to buy it!

review.title: Quiet Elegance
review.reviewText: A small elegant hotel with great personal service. Very quiet even though its located by busy Union Square. Great location for shopping, access to transportation. The bed was so amazingly comfortable I'm going to replace mine at home to be just like theirs! I would stay here again but not with kids....I wouldn't want to change the serene feeling.

review.title: Very enjoyable visit
review.reviewText: Only two things I will think about before booking again-the room service menu and the tub area in the really nice bathroom. A review I had read previous to booking my stay had said something about being careful near the tub. I am young and agile, but I could see that an elderly person or someone otherwise not very agile would have a difficult time getting in and out safely. Concerning the room service menu, this visit was the very time that I did not order room service while staying in a hotel. I didn't even touch the little bar cabinet! I actually went out instead to avoid the really high prices. I am not sure if it was because I was in San Francisco.

review.title: Comfort, Quiet, and Convenience
review.reviewText: My 3 girlfriends and I stayed in a deluxe room at Campton Place Hotel for 4 nights during our recent trip to San Francisco. Accommodations were spacious, plush, and immaculate. The bathroom was beautiful and fantastic water pressure in the shower was an unusual bonus. Normally, a 3rd floor room would prove to be too close to street level for a quiet night's sleep in a location as busy as Union Square. This turned out not to be the case at all. Our room was extremely quiet and restful, and all hotel staff we encountered went above and beyond to ensure a more than pleasant stay. I would definitely take advantage of the opportunity to stay at the Campton Place Hotel again!

review.title: It was nice, but not great
review.reviewText: The room was very small, the refrig didn't work, the toilet ran, lights flickered. Just not the best place I've ever stayed. Would recommend if you do stay there to request a room above the 2nd floor. It's nicer above.

review.title: Beautiful hotel.
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. Very clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful and friendly. We will stay there on our next trip to SF.

review.title: great, great place
review.reviewText: Great location near Union Square, great staff, room was wonderful (a truly top notch bed, great bathroom, room decor and layout was very well planned, didn't need to ask for a thing). Can't wait to go back! Loved Campton Place, highly recommend it.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: The bathroom was fantastic! A nice soak after a long hard day of shopping, sightseeing and walking the streets of San Francisco was one of the nicest parts of our stay at the Campton. The tubs are extra deep and seem wider than a standard tub - perfect for soaking. The location is great! Very central to everything. We took the BART train from the airport to Union Square and walked 2 or 3 blocks to the hotel. The only part of the hotel that I didn't like was that we were given a fifth floor room with a view of the brick building next door. The adjacent building was about 20 feet away. Also, the carpet on the fifth floor needed to be replaced. For the most part, I was very pleased and I will stay at the Campton next time I'm in San Francisco.

review.title: One of the Best in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Campton Place is an outstanding small hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Located a block from Union Square, it has all the personal amenities you could ask for, along with an outstanding restaraunt serving the best brunch in San Francisco.

review.title: Will use this hotel whenever I visit San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location - right in the heart of Union Square. Great for shopping and convenient to all public transportation. Lots of eating places, convenience stalls and even a pharmacy. Close to Chinatown is a plus when I have craving for chinese food.

review.title: san francisco's best
review.reviewText: this was the best hotel I have ever stayed in san francisco during the last ten years.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in the perfect place if you want to shop!!!

review.title: A gem of a hotel in the midst of the city
review.reviewText: It felt like a boutique hotel; intimate and cozy. Although the rooms were small, the bedding was top quality as were the furnishings. The staff were friendly, accommodating and just made you feel at home! I would not only recommend this little gem but frequent the hotel on any future visits to San Francisco. Only one thing would have made it better - a flat screen TV.

review.title: wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: I can't say enough about the Campton Place. Not only is it in the heart of San Fran, not only is it comfortable and clean, with superior bedding and soaps etc. but the staff was efficient, knowledgable, and incredibly warm. They greeted me by name each and every time I entered or exited, they were like a home away from home. Excellent.

review.title: Best in Union Square
review.reviewText: Campton Place is where you want to go for comfort, amenities, service and location, location, location. Just don't expect a room with a view.

review.title: Excellent location luxury hotel
review.reviewText: We were impressed at the cleanliness and comfort of Campton Place. Great location, just one block from cable car and bus stop. Luxury bed & linens, large bath. Friendly staff. Large terraced fitness center. We would definately return here if the price was right with Expedia. It happens that this hotel is out of my budget, as a saw on my guidebook. However, I saw Expedia's rates and immediately booked the room. I'm glad I did.

review.title: Excellent Experience
review.reviewText: My wife and I had an wonderful honeymoon in San Francisco due, in no small part, to Campton Place. The staff minding the concierge desk were spot on in recommending excellent restaurants, theatre shows, and other activities. Also, they were very friendly and prompt while arranging many of the reservations and ticket purchases I requested. The room, especially the bathroom, was fantastic! My wife loved the over-sized tub. The location of Campton Place is ideal; just far enough off of Union Square to keep foot traffic to an acceptable level while close enough to allow a nice(downhill!) walk to the stores.

review.title: nice but small
review.reviewText: Excellent service, location & food however room was small.OK for couples, not family needing a roll-a-way.

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: Great location. Outstanding service.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: Loved the location--could not have been better. Very clean and comfortable with excellent customer service. The concierge service was exemplary. It will be our first choice on our next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Great location and wonderful service
review.reviewText: We loved the location, just off Union Square and 2 blocks from Chinatown. I would recommend bringing a travel coffee pot if you have one and need coffee before you dress in the morning, as a small pot from room service is $14.00 after service charge and 18% gratuity(mandatory). If you can wait, there is, of course, a Starbucks right next door. The rooms are nice and the linens plush-the bathroom was unusually roomy. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but the after hours room service menu was extremely limited (4 items) such as $14.00 kraft mac & cheese.

review.title: Small and charming Union-square hotel
review.reviewText: Liked the charakter. Clean and stylish room, though small. service was kind and as expected. only gym was small but with view on union square (though w/o windows)

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This Hotel is a 4 1/2 star hotel and it is great on the service. The rooms are little small but fantastic bathrooms. Try to stay on the ninth floor or higher for the view of the building next to you isn't so hot. One of the best things is free bottled water. It doesn't seem like a big deal but it is a nice convenience.

review.title: Wonderful, cozy , upscale place!!
review.reviewText: The staff, was excellent, friendly and very helpful. The rooms were wonderful, spacious, clean and the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in at a hotel. I can't wait to go back!!

review.title: Near Union Square
review.reviewText: Campton Place is lovely and gracious, and the staff support is superb. You're just steps from Union Square, but don't expect a view ("we're not a view hotel" explained the front desk clerk). With that slight caveat, it is still our favorite place to stay in San Francisco

review.title: A great hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: We loved everything about this hotel! The rooms were attractive, functional and very comfortable. Everyone on staff was friendly, professional and helpful. And we ate one of the best dinners of our lives at the hotel restaurant! We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: I hated to leave!
review.reviewText: My husband and I had the opportunity to stay at the Campton Place hotel while away for a weekend in San Francisco. From the time we arrived, we were made to feel right at home. I have never experienced a hotel visit quite like this one. Everyone we encountered there - the doormen, front desk, maid service, and of course the restaurant (delicious, by the way) and lounge personnel, always had a smile and a friendly personality. They really go the extra mile - even without you asking for it! The appointments were beautiful and the room was spotless. We hated to leave the hotel when it was time to go. I look forward to staying there again and highly recommend it to anyone visiting San Francisco. Have a great trip!

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: Great, convenient location and friendly staff. All the people I dealt with were exceptionally friendly and helpful-some of the best I've ever experienced. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Will Definately Be Back!!!
review.reviewText: The service was excellent and the rooms very well appointed, very clean and room space while on the smaller size, very comfortable. (It is San Francisco afterall). I had never heard of this hotel before and usually stay at another 5 star hotel in the city when we visit, so I booked this hotel based on previous reviews and have to agree with the others before me this place is fantastic. Looking forward to coming bacl again soon.

review.title: Wait on you hand and foot
review.reviewText: Awsome

review.title: nice and cozy
review.reviewText: really relaxing hotel..close to everything.. perfect location.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: Great location near Union Square, shopping and restaurants. Room small, bathroom huge. Hotel restaurant superb. Beds extremely confortable.

review.title: Campton Place, an excellent Euro style hotel, centrally located in San Fransico
review.reviewText: Campton Place is located across the street from the Grand Hyatt. It is a smaller, European style hotel that has been total redone. The rooms and service are top shelf. A workout room is available. The restaurant is excellent. It is fairly close to the Moscone Center and most of the other major hotels. The shopping district is a short walking distance. It is a great choice for the business traveller.

review.title: Stay at the center of SF
review.reviewText: Very nice room with "like-new" finishes. Quiet and comfortable; within a block of the Union Square shopping district and numerous outstanding restaurants.
